Shelters.title: City of London - Homelessness Team
Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Housing provided for people considered in priority need of housing. Temporary accommodation may be available while enquiries are made. Tenancy relations service. General housing advice. Advice and assistance for single and non-priority homeless people. Rent deposit scheme.

Shelters.title: H&F Advice (LB Hammersmith and Fulham)
Shelters.info: Initial point of contact for all housing in LB Hammersmith and Fulham. Includes assessment of homelessness, advice on housing options & homelessness prevention (including access to financial assistance with securing private rented accommodation). Administration of the housing register.

Shelters.title: Haringey Council - Housing Advice
Shelters.info: Housing advice on landlord/tenant problems, harassment and eviction, rent and mortgage arrears, repairs and finding somewhere to live. Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Home Finder Scheme. Appointments available 9.30am-4pm Monday-Friday. Out of hours emergencies phone 020 8489 0000.

Shelters.title: LB Barking & Dagenham - Housing Advice and Homeless Persons Unit
Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Housing provided for people considered in priority need. Temporary accommodation may be available while enquiries are made about eligibility. Out of hours emergencies phone 020 8594 8356.

Shelters.title: LB Bexley - Prevention & Assessment Team
Shelters.info: Advice and information to anyone in the borough worried about losing their home, with the aim of preventing homelessness. Offer advice on mortgage and rent arrears and can liaise with landlords tp protect the rights of tenants. Advice and assitance with renting privately, including the Rent Direct scheme. Information on going on the council's housing register. Out of hours phone 020 8303 7171.

Shelters.title: LB Brent - Housing Resource Centre
Shelters.info: Assess homeless applicants and assist people who qualify for housing. Register and assess applications for the Housing Register. Process council tenancy transfers. Out of hours phone 020 8937 1234.

Shelters.title: LB Brent - Private Housing Information Unit
Shelters.info: Private sector housing information and advice for the general public in the London Borough of Brent. Private landlords lettings scheme. Rent deposit scheme.

Shelters.title: LB Brent - START Plus
Shelters.info: Central referral team co-ordinating access to supported housing for single homeless people with support needs and floating support services. To be eligible for support you need: proof of identification, access to public fund, proof of income and proof of being in receipt of benefit are needed.

Shelters.title: LB Bromley - Housing Options & Assessments
Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless/threatened with homelessness. Housing for people considered in priority need. Temporary accommodation may be available while enquiries are made. Tenancy relations service, general housing advice, advice & assistance for single/non-priority homeless people. Specialist young people's service. Out of hours emergencies 020 8464 4848

Shelters.title: LB Camden - Housing Options & Advice Service
Shelters.info: Provides a range of housing advice services to tenants and people looking for accommodation including singles and families who are threatened with homelessness, private tenants, housing association or co-operative tenants and owner occupiers. Specialist advice on housing options and housing rights.

Shelters.title: LB Croydon - Housing Options Section
Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Housing provided for people considered in priority need of housing. Temporary accommodation may be available while enquiries are made about eligibility.

Shelters.info: Advice for people who are homeless, threatened with homelessness or anyone needing housing advice. Advice on finding and keeping private sector accommodation, owner occupation, relationship breakdown, disrepair, illegal eviction, rehousing. Operate a rent deposit scheme.

Sub-office in Okehampton.

Temporary and permanent accommodation may be provided in line with homelessness legislation. Also offer general housing advice and information for private and council tenants and homeless people.

Shelters.title: Solihull Community Housing - Solihull
Shelters.info: Assessment of priority need under the Housing Act. Can provide temporary accommodation for people assessed as in priority need. Housing advice and information for private and council tenants and homeless people. Drop-in at Chelmsley Wood Shopping Centre Monday, Tuesday and Thursday 9am-5pm, Wednesday 10am-5pm, Friday 9am - 4.30pm and Saturday 9am-1pm.

Help and advice for private tenants with rent in advance and deposits. Assessment of entitlement for people who are homeless/threatened with homelessness, including provision of temporary accommodation if appropriate.

Shelters.info: Homelessness prevention and general housing advice service for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. We can assist with finding accommodation, including Temporary Accommodation where eligible, prevention work including mediation, negotiation with landlords and rent deposit scheme. Out of hours emergencies phone - 01827 709709 ? Option 1

Prevention of homelessness through assisting people into private rented accommodation, accessing social housing or enabling people to remain in their own homes. Advice on all housing options. Can also provide emergency temporary accommodation if necessary. Out of hours emergencies phone 01562 733178.

Shelters.info: General housing advice and homelessness prevention work. Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Out of hours emergencies phone 0845 056 8035.

Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. General housing advice and information for private and council tenants and homeless people. Out of hours emergencies phone 0844 984 1800.

Shelters.title: Bradford Council - Housing Options
Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Assistance with finding accommodation for people in priority need. General housing advice and information for private tenants, housing association and council tenants and homeless people.

Shelters.title: Bradford Council - Housing Services
Shelters.info: Advice for tenants of private landlords on issues relating to the condition of the property. Works closely with the Housing Options service also provided by Bradford Council.

Shelters.title: Broadacres Housing Association
Shelters.info: General housing advice and information for housing association tenants and people seeking to join the housing association waiting list. Homelessness is dealt with by the Council's Homeless Department (01609 779977).

Shelters.title: City of York Council - Housing Options
Shelters.info: Provision of housing options and homelessness prevention advice and services.

Shelters.title: Craven Council - Housing Options Team
Shelters.info: Housing advice on a wide range of issues for any household in our district who is homeless, at risk of homelessness or just having difficulties in their accommodation. Our emphasis is on early advice & prevention. Statutory services provided to those that are homeless including assessments and provision of temporary accommodation to priority need households. Out of hours: RYECARE 01653 699392.

Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Housing provided for people considered in priority need of housing. Shelters.info: Free, confidential and impartial housing advice and assistance to residents who have housing needs. Aim o reduce and prevent homelessness in North East Lincolnshire whilst making sure that homes are suitable and residents are able to manage their tenancy.

Shelters.title: North Lincolnshire Council - Housing Advice
Shelters.info: Housing advice and information to private and council tenants and homeless people. Assessment of priority need under the Housing Act. Temporary accommodation for those assessed as in priority need - those with children or pregnant, vulnerable because of age (60+), disability or at risk from violence. Out of hours phone 01724 276444. Appointments at local offices - call for details.

Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Housing provided for people considered in priority need of housing. Out of hours phone 07748 143170.

Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Provision of housing for people considered in priority need of housing. Temporary accommodation may be available while enquiries are made about eligibility. General housing advice and information for private and RSL tenants and homeless people. Out of hours emergencies phone 01653 697737.

Shelters.title: Scarborough Borough Council - Housing Options Team
Shelters.info: Assessment of housing options for people who may be homeless or threatened with homelessness. Housing advice, information and signposting to other relevant agencies. Full assessment under the terms of the current homelessness legislation and undertaking of the specific duties owed to applicants, which may include provision of temporary accommodation. Out of hours contact - 01723 351558.

Shelters.title: Selby District Council - Housing Services
Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Provision of housing for people considered in priority need of housing. Temporary accommodation may be available while enquiries are made about eligibility. Also offer general housing advice and information for private and council tenants and homeless people. Out of hours emergencies 01653 600941.

Shelters.title: Sheffield City Council - Housing Solutions
Shelters.info: Homeless prevention advice and assistance. Information on rehousing options in Sheffield. Also offers general housing advice and information to private and council tenants and owner occupiers. Out of hours emergencies phone 0800 731 1689.

Shelters.title: Wakefield MDC - Homelessness, Preventing Homelessness, Housing Options
Shelters.info: Advice, assistance and support to prevent homelessness. Work to try and prevent homelessness or to delay it until alternative arrangements can be found through information, guidance or further support. People with nowhere to stay will have their circumstances considered under homelssness legislation. Out of hours service via Council Contact Centre on 0845 850 6506 or by visiting a Police station.

Shelters.title: The Project Birmingham
Shelters.info: Advice centre specialising in Homeless Prevention, Welfare Benefits and Debt. Services include initial housing advice and information. Discuss housing options.  Referrals for access to accommodation. Support with key deposits. Assistance with form filling. Access to computers to bid for properties. Resettlement support. Crisis Support. Emergency food parcels. Citizen Cards. Fresh food scheme. Starter packs  Access to essential household items and referrals to food banks.

Shelters.title: 1625 Independent People
Shelters.info: Range of services for young people aged 16-25 who are homeless or in housing need. Supported accommodation in Bristol. Housing support and advice in South Gloucestershire. Drop-in housing advice at Patchway (phone 0117 969 5763).

Shelters.title: Ability Housing Association - Reading
Shelters.info: Floating support service for single people without dependents who need support to obtain and/or keep appropriate housing. Also offer advice and information on housing options and sources of specialist advice.

Shelters.title: Action for Children - Youth Reach
Shelters.info: Services for young people leaving local authority care. Help with benefits, accommodation, work, leisure, relationship problems. Referrals accepted only via social services.

Shelters.title: Action Housing and Support - Barnsley Floating Support Project
Shelters.info: Support to enable people to live as independently as possible in their own accommodation. Aimed at those aged 18+ with history of/at risk of offending, homeless/at risk of homelessness, leaving institutional accommodation/care, with substance misuse issues, or contact with the probation service. Advice, liaison with other agencies, support around benefits, budgeting, finding work, life skills.

Shelters.title: Action Housing and Support - Derby Floating Support Project
Shelters.info: Support to enable people to live as independently as possible in their own accommodation. Aimed at those aged 18+ with a history of/at risk of offending, and/or with substance misuse issues. Advice, liaison with other agencies, support around benefits, budgeting, life skills.

Shelters.title: Advice Portsmouth
Shelters.info: Generalist and specialist advice and assistance in debt, employment, housing, homelessness and related welfare benefits issues for benefit claimants and people who are homeless, potentially homeless or badly housed. Outreach services in Cosham.

Shelters.title: Advising London
Shelters.info: Advice and information for the local community on a range of issues. Generalist and specialist help and advice on welfare benefits, debt, employment and housing. Level 1 advice on immigration. Projects for the Irish community and for Bengali women. Court project providing housing repossession advice. Email advice. PHONE ADVICE NOT AVAILABLE.

Shelters.title: Advisory Service for Squatters
Shelters.info: Information on squatting. Issues covered include basic housing rights, illegal eviction, harassment of squatters, other housing options. Help for squatters on issues such as changing a lock, dealing with the police and utility companies. Publish the Squatters' Handbook.

Shelters.title: Advocates Advisory Service
Shelters.info: Information, advice, advocacy and support for families and individuals residing in temporary accommodation, BME communities and anyone in need of generalist advice, advocacy and support. Advice around legal matters, housing and homelessness, education, debt, welfare rights, employment and disability.

Shelters.title: Alabare - The Junction (Andover)
Shelters.info: Information, advice and guidance for young people aged 13-25. Help with benefits, education and training, drugs, employment. Job club. Supporting homeless project for young people. Access to computers and the internet. Sex and relationship education.

Shelters.title: All Saints Church, Islington
Shelters.info: Food and social contact for people who are homeless and on the margins. Breakfast Tuesday and Thursday 10am-12 noon. Informal advice on finding emergency accommodation, signposting to other organisations and other issues around homelessness.

Shelters.title: Arch (North Staffs)
Shelters.info: Advice and support services for a range of people across Staffordshire. Work with people who are in housing need, families in need of support, victims and perpetrators of domestic violence, refugees and people seeking to return to education, training and employment. Accommodation for single people and families.

Shelters.title: Arch Community Learning Services
Shelters.info: Employability & lifeskills training for anyone aged 16+ wanting to develop self-confidence, increase self-esteem & re-engage in positive activity. Practical lifeskills including setting up & managing a home, basic DIY. Social activities. Creative workshops. Volunteer opportunities with local businesses. DIY training programme - trainees provide basic service to other vulnerable groups in the area.

Shelters.title: Archway
Shelters.info: Advice and support for young people including young people from minority ethnic communities, care leavers, drug users, ex-offenders, homeless young people, refugees and asylum seekers, single parents, young people with mental health problems. Counselling. Careers guidance, information and advice on housing, health, education, benefits. Housing support. English classes, group work activities.

Shelters.title: Aspire Community Enterprise
Shelters.info: Self-help option for homeless people, ex-offenders and long term unemployed people who wish to secure an income through painting and decorating, window cleaning, gardening and landscaping. Work placement opportunities, apprenticeships and NVQ qualifications. Advice on welfare benefits, housing problems, training and future employment. Non-profit making social enterprise.

Shelters.title: Back on Track
Shelters.info: Education courses and support for vulnerable adults from four backgrounds: current and ex-offenders; people with substance misuse issues; people with mental health problems; people who are homeless/at risk of becoming homeless. Courses include basic skills, life skills, computing, art. Also offer mentoring and IAG. Also deliver courses in hostels, day centres and probation offices.

Shelters.title: Barka UK - Reconnection Project
Shelters.info: Street outreach work with Eastern European rough sleepers, who are destitute. Help people connect to homelessness day centres and work with them to prepare for reconnection with their families and communities. People can be referred to the Barka Network of Inclusion Program in Poland, where they can access detox, learn new work skills and build friendships with others who share their journey.

Shelters.title: Barnardo's - Young Women's Project
Shelters.info: Safe place for girls and young women at risk of sexual exploitation (aged 12-18) to relax and socialise. One-to-one support from keyworkers. Sexual health service, including advice, pregnancy testing, contraception and emergency contraception. Food and drink. Music, drama, art, photography. Showers and washing facilities. TV and video. Computers. By referral from Social Services.

Shelters.title: Basildon Community Resource Centre
Shelters.info: Range of services for homeless people, those on low incomes and unwaged people. Lettings agency. Help with form filling. Loans of clothes for job interviews. Community print service. Welfare rights and housing advice. Emergency food parcel scheme which can be accessed by referral from any local statutory or charity agency. Accepts long life food donations only. Contact centre for more info.

Shelters.title: Bench Outreach
Shelters.info: Advice, advocacy and signposting services for vulnerable people in the London Borough of Lewisham, including homeless people, ex-offenders and people with a drug or alcohol related problem.

Shelters.title: BHT Advice Centre - Housing Aid and Legal Centre
Shelters.info: Legal service offering housing advice. Advice on immigration, and access to immigration solicitors. Accommodation advice drop-in on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and Friday from 9.15am. Housing advice by appointment. Welfare benefits and debt advice by appointment.

Shelters.title: BHT Eastbourne Advice
Shelters.info: Advice and information on finding accommodation, homelessness, mortgage or rent arrears or other housing problems. Legal advice on tenants' rights, landlord responsibilities, eviction, disrepair. Accommodation register for non-statutory homeless people. Housing drop-ins from 1pm Monday and Thusday.

Shelters.title: BHT Hastings Advice
Shelters.info: Specialist legal advice on housing for anyone with a housing or homelessness problem.

Shelters.title: BIAS (Brent Irish Advisory Service)
Shelters.info: Information and advice for Irish people on housing, finding accommodation, benefits. Transition to Old Age project (Monday 10am-12.15pm by appointment). Children and families social work service. Elders project: day care, lunch club (Tuesday and Friday). Welfare advice service around benefit entitlement & housing - appts made at drop-ins Tues & Weds 9.30am - 12.30pm.

Shelters.title: Big Issue Foundation - Bristol
Shelters.info: Self-help option for homeless people who wish to secure an income through selling the Big Issue magazine. Support offered to vendors includes information, advice and guidance on housing and resettlement, mental health, substance misuse and welfare benefits. Basic IT skills course. Workshops for vendors and other homeless people including creative writing, alternative therapies, art etc.

Shelters.title: Big Issue in the Midlands - Birmingham
Shelters.info: Offers a self-help option to homeless people who wish to secure an income through selling the Big Issue magazine. Support offered to vendors includes informal advice and signposting on welfare benefits, housing and other issues around homelessness.

Shelters.title: Big Issue in the North
Shelters.info: Offer a self-help option for homeless people who want to secure an income by selling the Big Issue in the North magazine. Support offered to vendors includes advice on welfare benefits, housing, healthcare, drugs and alcohol. Education, training, resettlement support and group activities.

Shelters.title: Big Issue Service Broker Team (London)
Shelters.info: Signposting service to help vulnerably housed and homeless people find information on accommodation, resettlement and welfare rights issues (mainly for Big Issue vendors). Support around drugs, alcohol and mental health issues. Help with managing personal finances and limited financial support though a vendor support fund.

Shelters.title: Boaz Trust
Shelters.info: Accommodation, legal advice, pastoral and practical support for destitute refused asylum seekers and refugees in Greater Manchester. Male and Female Support Workers. Programme of activities for clients.

Shelters.title: Bond Scheme Selby
Shelters.info: Assists people who are on benefits, homeless or threatened with homelessness to secure housing in the private rented sector. Part of Selby District Council Private Sector Housing.

Shelters.title: Bournemouth Churches Housing Association
Shelters.info: Help, advice and accommodation for homeless people, people sleeping rough or in inadequate accommodation. Aims to help people access accommodation and resettle in the community. Floating support scheme for people with mental health or addiction problems to help them maintain their tenancies. Liaise with local landlords and the Probation Service.

Shelters.title: Bradford City Centre Project
Shelters.info: Advice, information and support for young people aged 16-25. Advice on housing, benefits, employment, education and training. Help with basic living skills, emergency hostel accommodation and supported tenancy scheme.

Shelters.title: Bradford StreetReach
Shelters.info: Street outreach work with people aged 16+ who are sleeping rough, those with no permanent home and those at risk of homelessness. Support with accessing appropriate accommodation and sustaining a life away from the streets. Help with accessing other services including substance misuse and mental health support. Drop-in sessions at day centres and other services.

Shelters.title: Brighter Futures - Rough Sleepers Team
Shelters.info: Daily street outreach work with people sleeping rough, offering help with finding accommodation, claiming benefits, registering with a GP.

Shelters.title: Bristol Housing Action Movement
Shelters.info: Advice, support and practical help for homeless people. Aims to house most of those who contact the project in temporary accommodation within 2 - 4 weeks of initial contact. Referrals to a wide range of other housing advice agencies and related services.

Shelters.title: BYHP (Supporting Young People in Housing Need)
Shelters.info: Advice, casework, information and support for young people in housing need. Casework in community care, housing and welfare benefits. Help with finding emergency accommodation. Support for young people to live independently. Access to register of supported accommodation and rent guarantee scheme. Nightstop scheme. Family mediation. Domestic abuse support.

Shelters.title: Cambridge House Law Centre
Shelters.info: Legal advice, assistance and representation in employment, housing and welfare benefits. Service by appointment only.

Shelters.title: CAN - Homelessness Action Team
Shelters.info: Advice and support for homeless people, particularly those with substance misuse problems and ex-offenders. Housing advice including referrals, pre-tenancy, resettlement, tenancy sustainment support. Referrals to detox, specialist agencies & CAN's own substance use counselling service. Benefits advice. Rough sleepers drop-in Mon, Weds 9.30am-12 noon with showers and laundry. Rent deposit scheme.

Shelters.title: Canterbury Housing Advice Centre
Shelters.info: Advice, information, representation and specialist help in housing matters for families and single people. Assist single people to find and keep private rented accommodation with a rent in advance and deposit scheme.

Shelters.title: CARE Rent Scheme
Shelters.info: Help and support for people in North East Lincolnshire who are experiencing extreme housing difficulty or are under threat of homelessness. Offers a limited guarantee to local landlords to help people secure private rented accommodation.

Shelters.title: CARIS Haringey
Shelters.info: Visits, supports and offers advice to families in temporary accommodation, including asylum seekers and refugees. Casework in housing and immigration (level 1). Mobile toy library, summer playscheme. ESOL classes.

Shelters.title: Caritas Diocese of Salford
Shelters.info: Range of support services for homeless children, families and young people. Services include advice, counselling, support for families and young mothers, respite care for disabled children and day care services. Outreach and resettlement services for homeless young women. Residential children's homes. Post-adoption service.

Shelters.title: Catch22 - Wigan
Shelters.info: Individual support to 16-25 year olds looking for a safe place to live or needing help with settling into the community. Tenancy support. Help with claiming benefits and budgeting skills. Access to education, training and employment opportunities. Support with health issues including substance use. Training to improve social and communication skills. Help with personal and family relationships.

Shelters.title: CAYSH - Housing Advice Project
Shelters.info: Advice and support for young people aged 16-21 who are homeless, at risk of homelessness or experiencing difficulties at home. Housing advice, family mediation and homelessness prevention, individual advocacy and support. Multi-agency service, including housing and social services. New service users must arrive before 3.30pm.

Shelters.title: Centrepoint Streets Project
Shelters.info: Range of projects for disadvantaged people. Education & occupational development projects for children & unemployed young people in disadvantaged areas. Citizen advocacy. Support service for homeless people Mon-Thurs 10am-4pm at 26R Carters Green - advice & info, debt support, clothing store, food vouchers. Daily soup kitchen. Night respite centre.

Shelters.title: CHAS (Bristol) Housing Advice Service
Shelters.info: Advice, information and advocacy for homeless people and people in housing need. Service is by appointment at a number of locations in Bristol. Subjects covered include homelessness, landlord and tenant issues, and housing related welfare rights and debt.

Shelters.title: CHAS @ St Vincent's
Shelters.info: Specialist level advice on housing, debt and welfare benefits. Housing possession duty scheme at Bradford County Court on mortgage and rental possession hearing days. Furniture scheme Mon-Fri 8.30am-4pm (01274 731909), clothing and household goods store. Support for vulnerable people who are at risk of becoming homeless.

Shelters.title: Cheltenham 1st Stop
Shelters.info: Multi-agency one stop shop for people with multiple problems relating to homelessness, family breakdown, substance misuse, mental health, involvement in the criminal justice system and social deprivation. Access to housing options and emergency accommodation, mental health assessment and support, floating/tenancy support and crisis intervention.

Shelters.title: Cheltenham Housing Aid Centre
Shelters.info: Advice and assistance on housing, homelessness and finding accommodation for people in housing difficulty who have mental health problems.

Shelters.title: Chester Aid to the Homeless (CATH)
Shelters.info: Range of services for homeless people. Emergency nightshelter and move-on accommodation. Rent deposit scheme for single people aged 18+, who are claiming benefits or on a low income, with ongoing and additional support for those resettled through the scheme.

Shelters.title: Children's Society - New Londoners
Shelters.info: Advice, advocacy and case work support for young migrants, asylum seekers and refugees aged 14 to 21, who are destitute or at risk of destitution, across London.

Shelters.title: Children's Society - Safe in the City
Shelters.info: Advice, advocacy and support for young people aged 17 and under who are at risk and on the streets. Work with young people, those who have run away, those involved in selling sex, unaccompanied asylum seeking children and young people. Advice on benefits, drugs, finding accommodation, health, sexual health.

Shelters.title: Cleveland Housing Advice Centre
Shelters.info: Advice and information for homeless and badly housed people. Casework in debt, housing and welfare benefits. Representation at court hearings, appeals and tribunals.

Shelters.title: Community Housing Aid
Shelters.info: Advice on housing rights and accommodation options. Smartmove rent deposit guarantee scheme (by referral from the local authority only). Resettlement and tenancy support for people leaving Wonford Hospital and for ex-offenders leaving prison. Emergency accommodation project (Nightstop) for 16-25 year olds.

Shelters.title: Connection Floating Support Organisation
Shelters.info: Provides advice, advocacy and practical help to vulnerable people. Services include help around preventing homelessness, tenancy sustainment, drug and alcohol use, offending and mental health difficulties.

Shelters.title: Consett Churches Detached Youth Project
Shelters.info: Services for young people aged 12-23. Advice and information on employment, homelessness, finding accommodation, health, sexual health and alcohol/drugs. Leisure activities, workshops and groupwork on a range of topics. Furniture scheme. Editing suite and printing facility. Community transport minibus available for hire.

Shelters.title: Cornelius Fund
Shelters.info: Rent and deposit guarantee scheme to help people without the necessary funds secure private rented accommodation. Second hand clothes and household goods shop.

Shelters.title: Counted In
Shelters.info: Street outreach and resettlement service for people aged 18+ sleeping rough in Manchester. Advice, signposting and support to move into accommodation.

Shelters.title: County Community Projects
Shelters.info: Foyer service with access to accommodation, training, employment and education options for young people aged 16-25. Juvenile Support Team working with young offenders. Casework in housing, welfare benefits and young people's issues. Family Support Scheme for families at risk. Youth information shop. Floating support for vulnerable adults of working age. Parenting support. Outreach services.

Shelters.title: Creekside Learning Centre
Shelters.info: Help for homeless people, foyer residents and people in supported housing with all aspects of finding work, education or training, provided in an informal setting. Help with job applications and preparing a CV. Vocational guidance and recruitment advice. Advice on training. Use of internet and access to newspapers.

Shelters.title: CGL - Cambridge Street Outreach Team
Shelters.info: Assertive outreach team working with people sleeping rough, street based drug & alcohol users, sex workers & those begging. Advice and referrals to services such as primary health care, substance misuse services, counselling, housing & benefits. Assess the support needs of rough sleepers and help them to access accommodation. Team includes specialist alcohol CPN working with street based drinkers.

Shelters.title: Depaul UK - Baseline
Shelters.info: Mentoring service which matches volunteer mentors with young people who have a background of homelessness and need support in making the transition into independent living. Also runs group sessions covering issues affecting young people.

Shelters.title: Depaul UK - Drive Ahead Project
Shelters.info: Six week employability courses for young homeless people. Courses include CV preparation, job search, presentation skills, confidence building, interview techniques, preparation for the driving theory test and some shared driving lessons (dependent on attendance and behaviour). Course participants can self refer or be referred by a homelessness agency.

Shelters.title: Depaul UK - North East
Shelters.info: Support for young homeless people. Information on housing and benefits. Supported housing schemes and lodgings. Food voucher scheme. Mentoring and befriending for young people in new tenancies. Independent living skills courses.

Shelters.title: Depaul UK - Oldham Reconnect
Shelters.info: Works with young people aged 15 ½-25 who are homeless or at risk of homelessness, and with their families. One-to-one and family mediation. Aim is to improve communication and build bridges so that young people can either remain at home, return home or have support from their families to live independently.

Shelters.title: Developing Health and Independence
Shelters.info: Range of services for people who are socially excluded because of poor housing, lack of employable skills or drug and alcohol problems. Services include structured day care, groupwork, harm reduction work, needle/syringe exchange, counselling, aftercare, family and carers support, criminal justice work, housing support.

Shelters.title: DHA
Shelters.info: Legal advice, representation & advocacy for people facing homelessness, tenants & owner-occupiers needing to know about housing rights. Subjects covered include illegal eviction, disrepair, rent/mortgage arrears, housing benefit, tenancy agreements, harassment, domestic violence, finding somewhere to live, possession actions. Debt & benefit advice. Formerly known as Derbyshire Housing Aid.

Shelters.title: Dogs Trust - Hope Project
Shelters.info: Free neutering, vaccinations, microchipping, worming, flea treatment, and subsided emergency veterinary care for dogs whose owners are homeless/in housing crisis (squatting, sleeping rough, living in hostels, temporary accommodation, on unauthorised travellers's sites) through a veterinary entitlement card scheme. Advice for hostels, day centres, shelters on accepting clients with dogs.

Shelters.title: Doncaster Housing Advice Service
Shelters.info: Advice, information and casework service for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Advice on housing problems, including finding accommodation, disrepair, rent/mortgage arrears, harassment, eviction. Specialist advice on welfare benefits and community care. Outreach sessions and home visits are available.

Shelters.title: Doncaster Housing for Young People
Shelters.info: Advice, information and support for young people (16-25) who are homeless or inadequately housed. Advice and information on finding accommodation and other housing support needs. Drop-in at St Peter's in Chains and Baptist Church, Chequer Road, Thursday 12 noon ? 2.30pm, offers hot meal and housing advice. Outreach service. Supported lodgings Service, and a Floating Support Service (01302 738198).

Shelters.title: Doorway
Shelters.info: Advice and information for young people aged 16-25 who are homeless, threatened with homelessness or living in temporary accommodation. Advice and assistance with finding accommodation, particularly in the private rented sector. Welfare benefits advice, housing support and development service.

Shelters.title: E C Roberts Centre
Shelters.info: Community resource supporting families in need, including homeless families and families affected by family breakdown difficulties. Projects include Child Contact Centre, family intervention service, family tenancy support, supported housing and temporary accommodation schemes. Also run a day nursery and playscheme.

Shelters.title: Ealing Law Centre
Shelters.info: Legal advice and information on housing and immigration issues. Housing advice is provided for those who are eligible for legal aid and for cases which are still in scope.

Shelters.title: Earls Court Community Project
Shelters.info: Christian based service offering advice, counselling and support for people with a range of problems, including alcohol or drug abuse, prostitution, poverty. Coffee bar Tues and Weds. Women's friendship club Thurs. Meals, help with clothing, furniture, finding accommodation. Individual and family support. Help with writing letters, filling in forms, CVs. Help with emotional or spiritual issues.

Shelters.title: East Northants Community Services
Shelters.info: Range of services for the local community. Community cafe. Food supply project for people on benefits. Household goods recycling scheme. Advice on homelessness and housing, debt and accessing support services. Also run an emergency direct access hostel and a move-on project.

Shelters.title: East Sussex Welfare Reform
Shelters.info: Helpline providing benefits advice for all working age residents of East Sussex. This can lead to face to face appointments for benefits eligibility checks, help completing benefit application forms, and specialist support including help with appeals. In some circumstances advisers can make home visits.

Shelters.title: Easter Team (Christian Caring in Crisis)
Shelters.info: Help and support for people in need or who are experiencing hardship. Provide food, clothing, advice, some counselling and, where appropriate, financial assistance. Provide free food - up to 50 hot meals each Saturday. Please call for venue information.

Shelters.title: Elmore Community Services
Shelters.info: Advice, and practical/emotional support for people with complex needs (including mental health, substance misuse, learning disabilities/difficulties, physical health, offending, challenging behaviour, finances, or homelessness). Support may include finding/keeping accommodation, help with benefits and budgeting, support to access health services, and advocacy.

Shelters.title: Encompass Southwest
Shelters.info: Provides a range of services to people across Northern Devon who are experiencing crisis and hardship. Works to prevent and resolve homelessness, rough sleeping and to reduce the impact of poverty and financial exclusion. Services include advice, advocacy and referrals around housing, benefits, money and debt and practical help including food parcels and clothes provision.

Shelters.title: Focus Homeless Outreach Team
Shelters.info: Community mental health team offering support to homeless people with mental health problems. Street outreach work. Sessions in hostels and day centres.

Shelters.title: Foundation - Calderdale Team
Shelters.info: Provides a range of advice, advocacy, floating support and accommodation services for people who are socially excluded, including homeless people, ex-offenders, young people with support needs and care leavers.

Shelters.title: Foundation - Craven Team
Shelters.info: Range of support services for vulnerable and socially excluded people, including young people who are homeless/at risk of homelessness, ex-offenders, people with substance misuse or mental health problems, victims of domestic violence. Homelessness prevention work. Tenancy support. Family mediation. help finding emergency accommodation. Supported housing.

Shelters.title: Foundation - Durham Team
Shelters.info: Housing related support for offenders/those at risk of offending aged 16+. Intensive 1-1 support for up to 2 years. Provide supported accommodation for the more vulnerable clients. Support for young people aged 16 and 17 who are homeless/at risk of homelessness. Aims to resolve any housing issues facing the clients, with onward referrals to support services once accommodation has been found.

Shelters.title: Foundation - Leeds
Shelters.info: Advice and support for young people aged 16-25 who are homeless. Advice on homelessness, finding accommodation, benefits, education, training, employment, money and debt, sexuality, sexual or physical abuse and sexual health. Befriending, advocacy and housing management support to assist young people to live independently. Housing, support and signposting for offenders.

Shelters.title: Foundation - Scarborough
Shelters.info: Supported accommodation for 16-24yrs. Temporary accommodation for 16-17yrs. Support for ex-offenders - resettlement and accommodation. Probation service work. Support for people suffering domestic abuse, including tenancy issues and accommodation. Refuge accommodation scheme. 50 units of support. Information for young people about homelessness, housing rights, benefits, employment and training.

Shelters.title: Foundation - Selby Team
Shelters.info: Range of floating support services designed to enable people (16+) to secure & maintain accommodation. Provides support around areas of substance misuse, budgeting, reducing offending, minimising harm & removing the barriers to community participation . Specific work with 16-25 YO's & high risk offenders, including scheme for perpetrators of domestic violence. Referral from Selby District Council.

Shelters.title: Foundation - York Team
Shelters.info: Range of support services for vulnerable people, including young people who are homeless/at risk of homelessness, ex-offenders, substance misusers and teenage parents. Support around housing, finding accommodation, debt, independent living skills, tenancy sustainment.

Shelters.title: Framework - Homelessness Prevention Service
Shelters.info: Support for people to maintain their home and reduce the risk of potential homelessness. Tailored support packages established to deliver crisis interventions, one off advice sessions, individually planned support programs and lower level intervention. Support via drop in surgeries offers a wide range of support, including dealing with homeless applications, evictions and court proceedings.

Shelters.title: Gems
Shelters.info: Housing advice, tenancy support and advocacy for vulnerable homeless people on a range of issues. Education and employment training. Activities, include Gems FC (Football), ICT / Computing and Music workshops.

Shelters.title: Greenwich Housing Rights
Shelters.info: Specialist legal advice on housing problems for those working, living or wishing to live in Greenwich. Advice for tenants, homeless people, those in housing need, owner occupiers facing repossession. Representation at possession hearings. Drop-in session Monday 2-4pm, Wednesday 10am-12 noon. Outreach service at Woolwich Town Hall Tuesday 5-7pm.

Shelters.title: Grimsby and Cleethorpes Area Doorstep
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre offering information and support to young homeless people aged 16-25. Information on benefits, education and training, finding accommodation and housing rights. Also provide temporary supported accommodation for young single people and young parents aged 16-25. Outreach and floating support service to young people with housing related problems in their own homes.

Shelters.title: Groundswell
Shelters.info: Provides a range of advice and advocacy services for people experiencing homelessness. Works to enable homeless and vulnerable people to take more control of their lives, have a greater influence on services and to play a fuller role in their community.

Shelters.title: Hambleton Bond Scheme
Shelters.info: Assists people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness to secure housing in the private rented sector. Part of Hambleton District Council Housing Advice and Homelessness Service. 01609 767267 emergency out of hours line.

Shelters.title: Haringey Irish Cultural and Community Centre
Shelters.info: Centre providing activities and cultural events/entertainments. Advice on benefits, housing, employment and education. Disability advice service. Group for people with disabilities. Training service with IT courses and job placement. Daily lunch clubs for older people run by social services. Art classes, tea dances and outings for older people. Home visits for isolated vulnerable people.

Shelters.title: Hastings Advice and Representation Centre (HARC)
Shelters.info: Advice and information on a range of issues for people who are unemployed, on low incomes or who have a long term illness or disability. Specialist help in welfare benefits. Representation at first tier and upper tribunals. Grants to help with returning to work. Starter grants for young single homeless people. Phone advice Monday-Thursday afternoons. Outreach advice surgery in Bexhill.

Shelters.title: Health Improvement Service - Lifestyles and Inequalities
Shelters.info: Provide health improvement services for target groups to address health inequalities. Specific groups include Gypsies and Travellers, refugees, and homeless communities. Support to access primary health care services. Health education and promotion. Education and information for primary care staff.

Shelters.title: Herts Health Action with the Homeless
Shelters.info: Service to support people who are homeless or at risk of homelessness and have mental health and substance misuse problems. Support for people to access services that will help them towards mental health recovery and abstinence from substances as well as supporting them to access or maintain tenancies whilst they manage such complex needs.

Shelters.title: Herts Young Homeless Group
Shelters.info: Advice, information and mediation for homeless young people aged 16-24. Mediation for family conflict. Tenancy sustainment to help young people maintain accommodation. Toolkit used in prevention of homeless work in schools. Service user involvement programme. Health services for people aged 16-65 available throughout the county, phone 01707 251374. Operate via a number of sites across the county.

Shelters.title: Hilltop Aid
Shelters.info: Advice, information and support for rough sleepers, people living in temporary accommodation, women facing domestic violence aged 18+. Advice on homelessness prevention/housing options. Referrals to specialist agencies for support on substance misuse and mental health. Debt, benefits and healthy lifestyles advice. Basic and employability skills training. Sleeping bags, blankets, toiletries.

Shelters.title: Homeless and New Arrivals Health Team
Shelters.info: Specialist outreach team working with homeless people, asylum seekers and refugees. Help people to access mainstream services. Provide health assessments and TB screening for asylum seekers new to Bradford. Community TB screening. Health assessments and interventions for people out of touch with mainstream services.

Shelters.title: Homeless Mental Health Service - Leicestershire Partnership NHS Trust
Shelters.info: Mental health drop-in and outreach service for homeless people. Mental health assessments, informal support, referrals to other agencies. Available Monday-Friday 9am-12 noon at the DAWN Centre, Conduit Street LE2 0JN (by train station). Regular visits to hostels. Run by Leicestershire Partnership NHS Trust.

Shelters.title: Homemaker Southwest
Shelters.info: Range of services aimed at preventing homelessness. Tenancy sustainment across SW England. Mortgage arrears advice (Devon). Resettlement service for homeless people (Devon). Services for offenders in N.Devon, Torridge & N.Cornwall, including Accommodation Gateway, intensive support service, rent deposit scheme. Inside Out project - accommodation support for families of prisoners (Devon).

Shelters.title: Hope Worldwide
Shelters.info: Advice for homeless people, including referrals to hostels and assistance with finding private rented accommodation. Also provide a residential drug and alcohol rehabilitation programme and a volunteer mentoring programme for people who have been through the rehab programme or the homelessness programme.

Shelters.title: Horton Housing Association - Community Support Agency
Shelters.info: Floating support for vulnerable people in the Bradford area, including people with mental health problems, alcohol and drug problems and tenancy problems. Also provide home-based floating support for young people over 16 who are isolated or socially excluded. Evening and weekend service by arrangement.

Shelters.title: Housing Interaction Trust
Shelters.info: Advice and information for 16-25 year olds who are homeless or need housing advice. 6 supported flats. Project supporting young people in accommodation, offering help with budgeting, social skills, form filling.

Shelters.title: Humbercare
Shelters.info: Tenancy support for high risk and vulnerable care leavers and those at risk of offending in Hull, North and North east Lincolnshire and East Riding of Yorkshire. Mentoring project working with Humberside Probation. Supported accommodation for young people. Volunteer befriending project in North Lincolnshire. Life skills education project.

Shelters.title: Jericho Foundation
Shelters.info: Support for anyone facing disadvantage to overcome social problems and get back into employment, including the long term unemployed, homeless people, those with a history of substance misuse or a criminal record. Social enterprises offering paid work experience, personal development plans, vocational training, ongoing mentoring. Events based social club. Jobsearch suite, IT facilities.

Shelters.title: Key
Shelters.info: Information, advocacy, counselling and practical assistance for young people aged 16-25 who are homeless or who have housing problems. Subjects covered include finding accommodation, housing rights, benefits, education and training. Support for young people with new tenancies. Family mediation. Life coaching to help young people get ready for employment.

Shelters.title: Key to the Door
Shelters.info: Range of personal development courses for young people at risk of homelessness and young/teenage parents. Initial courses provide daily telephone support, transport to and from the venues and on-site childcare. Sessions on getting and maintaining a tenancy, budgeting, confidence and self esteem builing, and practical sessions on home safety and health.

Shelters.title: Lancaster and District YMCA - Doorstep Project
Shelters.info: Information and advice for the general public. Cover a range of issues, including benefits, education and training, employment, money and debt, health and relationship difficulties. Specialist housing advice. Rent bond guarantee scheme to assist people in accessing private rented accommodation.

Shelters.title: Leeds Irish Health and Homes
Shelters.info: Leeds Irish Health and Homes offer a variety of services and support, not only to the Irish community in Leeds, but also to the wider community as a whole. The wider community services include: housing and advice, support & outreach services - especially for people with mental health issues. (See notes for more)

Shelters.title: Leicester Homeless Outreach Team
Shelters.info: Outreach support services for people who are sleeping rough in Leicester. Advice on benefits, information on GPs and other health services. Alcohol, drug and mental health referrals. Can accompany service users to appointments. Referrals to temporary hostel accommodation and Housing Options Centre. Contact with service users on the street or via day centres (where appointments are available).

Shelters.title: Leicestershire Partnership NHS Trust Homeless Mental Health Service
Shelters.info: Outreach service working with homeless people with mental health problems in Leicester City. Information, advice, support and signposting to other services.

Shelters.title: LGBT Jigsaw
Shelters.info: One-stop shop for young LGBT people (under 25) who are homeless or having trouble at home. Services include mentoring, supported housing & lodgings, independence training, general support if homeless or living in a hostile environment. Partnership project of Stonewall Housing, Albert Kennedy Trust, PACE & GALOP. Drop-in session every Thursday 2-3.30pm at THT.

Shelters.title: Lifeshare
Shelters.info: Street outreach and resettlement services for homeless young people and young people at risk of exploitation. Weekend breakfasts Saturday, Sunday 7am-8.15am at Charter Street Ragged School, 142 Dantzic Street, M4 - by CIS towers. Temporary day centre open over Christmas week 7am-7pm, provides breakfast, lunch, tea and nursing services.

Shelters.title: Light for Life
Shelters.info: Christian organisation offering support for young people. Drop-in advice, information, help with finding accommodation and benefits advice. Life skills training and counselling.

Shelters.title: Local Solutions - Accommodation Project
Shelters.info: Social welfare projects for vulnerable and excluded people. Includes community safety initiatives, energy conservation schemes and domiciliary care. Support for carers and elderly and disabled people. Also run training programmes leading to national vocational qualifications. Offers accommodation, education and training advice, benefits advice and resettlement support for 16 & 17 year olds.

Shelters.title: Local Solutions - Wirral Supported Lodgings
Shelters.info: Supported lodgings scheme for young homeless 16 and 17 year olds. Accommodation is with registered householders in the Merseyside and Wirral areas. The scheme includes advice on education and training, welfare benefits, money and budgeting, health care and life skills. Also offers rehabilitation support and support with moving into independent housing.

Shelters.title: Local Solutions Supported Lodgings - Knowsley
Shelters.info: Supported lodgings scheme for young homeless people aged 16 - 18. Accommodation is with registered householders in the Merseyside area. The scheme includes advice on education and training, welfare benefits, money and budgeting, health care and life skills. Also offers counselling, rehabilitation support and support with moving into independent housing.

Shelters.title: Lodgers
Shelters.info: Assistance with finding accommodation for people who are or have been homeless or who are in housing need. Keep a register of landlords who let bedsit accommodation or rooms in their own homes.

Shelters.title: London Irish Care
Shelters.info: Advice for the Irish community on a range of issues including housing, homelessness and welfare rights. Advice and assistance with identification issues. Outreach service.

Shelters.title: M25 Housing and Support Group
Shelters.info: Advice and specialist help in community care, housing and welfare benefits for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness.

Shelters.title: Mendip YMCA - Homeless Services Department
Shelters.info: Services for young people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness, including young people leaving care. Deposit guarantee scheme. Move-on scheme providing help with securing accommodation and ongoing support. Emergency housing scheme for 16-25 year olds, providing up to 7 nights accommodation within the homes of local families. 2 supported housing projects. Family mediation.

Shelters.title: Missing Link Housing Service
Shelters.info: Support for women with mental health problems who are homeless, struggling to maintain their tenancy or are in unsuitable accommodation. Support for clients to stay in self-contained flats or shared housing. Counselling. Liaison with psychiatric services. Help with benefit applications, buying furniture, utilities connection, budgeting. Self harm support. Training, education, employment service.

Shelters.title: Missing People
Shelters.info: 24 hour confidential support, help and advice by phone, email, text and online for anyone searching for a missing loved one, and anyone who knows their loved one may consider themselves missing, including the opportunity to reconnect.

Shelters.title: Moving On
Shelters.info: Work with homeless young people aged 16-25, helping them to find accommodation and maintain their tenancies. Offer information, advice and guidance on finding accommodation, benefits, housing rights and homelessness. Floating support service for young people in their own tenancies and provide peer education in schools.

Shelters.title: Next Step Rent Deposit Scheme
Shelters.info: Assists single people and families who are in priority need and on a low income to access private rented accommodation by providing a guarantee for landlords of up to one month's rent in place of a cash deposit. Support in finding/securing accommodation, claiming benefits and negotiating with landlords. Ongoing support once people have secured a tenancy around budgeting and other life skills.

Shelters.title: No Second Night Out (Merseyside)
Shelters.info: Provide a rapid response to new rough sleeping. Links those who migrate into Merseyside back into services where their local connection means they are most likely to sustain a life away from the streets. Provide a single offer based on the assessment of each individual's needs and liaise with services, negotiate and advocate on a client's behalf.

Shelters.title: North East Windhill Community Association
Shelters.info: Centre for the local community. Advice on benefits, housing and disability. Furniture store at 7 Crag Road, Windhill provides furniture and household goods at affordable prices for people who are receiving benefits or on a low income.

Shelters.title: North West Leicestershire Homeless Project
Shelters.info: Information and advice on housing related issues, for single people and couples of all ages who are homeless, threatened with homelessness or in housing need. Accommodation register for homeless people. Liaise with statutory and voluntary agencies on behalf of clients.

Shelters.title: Notts Housing Advice
Shelters.info: Advice, advocacy and representation for people who are homeless or badly housed. Areas covered include security of tenure, disrepair, homelessness, harassment and illegal eviction, housing benefit, seeking accommodation, rehousing, rent and mortgage arrears, possession proceedings. Outreach service in Newark on Thursday and Mansfield on Friday. Drop-in service at Nottingham Housing Aid on Monday.

Shelters.title: Nugent Care - Housing Support Unit
Shelters.info: Housing Support Unit providing a floating support service and pre tenancy service to clients at risk of homelessness or moving into their new home. Supported accommodation service provides accommodation up to 2 years with support to move on to their own tenancies. Starter packs such as bedding, pots and pans etc via Material and Welfare Aid Scheme.

Shelters.title: Open Door (Thurrock)
Shelters.info: Information, advice and support for young people and vulnerable adults. Housing advice and support service. Counselling service. Advocacy and mentoring for looked after children and young people. Substance misuse project for under 18s. Substance misuse service, including needle exchange for vulnerable adults.

Shelters.title: Open House
Shelters.info: Foyer scheme for young people based within an arts and advice centre. Offers advice, information and training. Centre houses around 6 organisations, including a 10-bed foyer and move-on flats. Cafe on site.

Shelters.title: P3 - Navigator Guidance and Advice Service
Shelters.info: Streetwork with rough sleepers in Wolverhampton. Provide contact, emotional support, links to other services and help with accessing emergency accommodation.

Shelters.title: PATH (Plymouth Access to Housing)
Shelters.info: Housing advice & support for refugees, offenders, people using mental health services & drugs services & those at risk of sleeping rough in Plymouth. Support for rough sleepers. PRS Access including deposit guarantees to enable homeless people to access private rented accommodation. Landlords are issued with a 12 month guarantee for a deposit for rent arrears, damage or rent in lieu of notice.

Shelters.title: Phoenix Futures - Sheffield Community Services
Shelters.info: Individual programmes for substance misusers who want help to be drug/alcohol free. Partnership work with other agencies to provide support for homeless people and clients living in hostel accommodation. Young people's project. Project for people on probation.

Shelters.title: Phoenix Futures - Town Centre Outreach Service
Shelters.info: Street outreach work with people sleeping rough in Birkenhead town centre. Support with addressing substance misuse and related health problems, finding hostel accommodation and registering as homeless, obtaining benefits advice, finding a GP and accessing other appropriate services. Also run advice surgeries at various venues in the Wirral.

Shelters.title: Porchlight - Rough Sleeper Service
Shelters.info: Support for entrenched rough sleepers across Kent. Help with finding accommodation and linking to appropriate services. Also a 'Reactive' service across Kent based on the No Second Night Out model, responding to reprorts from agencies and the public and providing an intensive service for those new to the streets. 24 hour helpline for emergency housing issues.

Shelters.title: Princes Trust - Fairbridge Programme (Hackney Centre)
Shelters.info: Youth work, outreach, advice, information, support for children and young people aged 13-25.

Shelters.title: Providence Row
Shelters.info: Advice for people who are homeless (or vulnerable to homelessness) on issues around housing, benefits, mental health, substance misuse, learning and training.

Shelters.title: ReachOut Dorset (Delivering ReRun - Dorset Runaways Service)
Shelters.info: Outreach service for rural Dorset providing advice, information and support for young people (under 21) who have run away from home or are at risk of running away from home, are being forced to leave home due to domestic crisis or are at risk of having no secure or safe place to live. Also for the families of young people who have run away from home.

Shelters.title: Ryedale Bond Guarantee Scheme
Shelters.info: Assists people in housing need to secure housing in either the social or private rented sectors. Advice given regarding access to the choice based lettings scheme for North Yorkshire. Access tot he Council-run Bond Guarantee and Rent in Advance schemes for qualifying applicants. Must be in housing need, have a low income and a valid local connection to Ryedale.

Shelters.title: SAFE@LAST
Shelters.info: Services for young people aged 16 and under who have run away or been forced to leave home, or who are at risk of doing so. Services include telephone helpline, one-to-one support and preventative work in schools around the issue of running away. Also provide detatched street work and a children's emergency refuge.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army - Bristol Tenancy Support Team
Shelters.info: Floating tenancy support for people in danger of their tenancy breaking down. Support with benefits and accessing education and employment services. Support can be provided for up to two years.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army - Early Intervention and Prevention Team
Shelters.info: Help and advice for people sleeping rough or at risk of becoming homeless. Advice on benefits, housing rights, money and debt, drugs and alcohol. Street outreach service. Help to find rough sleepers suitable accommodation. Drop-in Monday-Friday 10am-12 noon.

Shelters.title: Scotscare and Borderline
Shelters.info: Advice and information for Scottish people on housing/homelessness, benefits and employment. Make referrals to specialist agencies where appropriate. Drop-in for newly arrived Scots 9.30am-4.30pm Monday-Friday (except Wednesday 2pm-4pm). Can offer assistance to people seeking to return to Scotland and resettlement support in Scotland. Access to Hostel accommodation at the YMCA Walthamstow.

Shelters.title: Second Step Floating Support Scheme
Shelters.info: Intensive resettlement service to enable homeless people with mental health needs to access independent housing association or council accommodation. Pre-resettlement advice. Practical support with moving, followed by up to 3 years ongoing resettlement support to ensure that the client has the skills to maintain their tenancy.

Shelters.title: Sefton Supported Lodgings
Shelters.info: Supported lodgings scheme for young homeless people aged 16-25. Accommodation is with registered householders in the Merseyside area. The scheme includes advice on education and training, welfare benefits, money and budgeting, health care and life skills. Also liaises with other specialist agencies and offers support with moving into independent housing.

Shelters.title: SHAID
Shelters.info: Housing advice and support for young people aged 16-25 who are homeless or at risk of homelessness. Advice on housing options if thinking about leaving home. Floating support service to help young people maintain their tenancies. Help with filling in forms and applying for benefits or grants. Help with housing applications. Advocacy. Peer support and training through the Neighbour Hut project.

Shelters.title: Shelter - Birmingham Support Services
Shelters.info: Practical and emotional support for families settling into new accommodation after homelessness. Help with benefits, accessing childcare and obtaining tools. DIY skills advice. Support for victims of domestic violence. Youth crime team - intervention in families with offending children. Family group conferencing for families with relationship breakdown.

Shelters.title: Shelter - Devon
Shelters.info: Advice and specialist help for anyone with a housing or housing related problem. Drop-in service providing assistance on a wide range of housing and homelessness issues.

Shelters.title: Shelter - Eastern Counties
Shelters.info: Specialist help and advice for anyone with a housing problem. Advocacy and representation. Drop-in service in Norwich and appointments available in Colchester, Great Yarmouth and Kings Lynn.

Shelters.title: Shelter - Greater Manchester Advice and Support Service
Shelters.info: Advice and information for anyone with housing, debt, welfare benefit advice and support needs. Specialist advice for people who have a private landlord or are trying to find accommodation in the private rented sector. Legal advice for people with complex housing issues. Housing?related support to people returning to Manchester from prison. Specialist debt, welfare benefits and housing advice.

Shelters.title: Shelter - Lancashire Housing Advice Centre
Shelters.info: Specialist help in housing, benefits and debt. Information Resource Centre available for clients to use phone and IT resources to assist with housing and financial issues as well as guided self-help services.

Shelters.title: Shelter - Legal Services Bristol
Shelters.info: Legal advice for clients who are eligible for full public funding and are experiencing the issues including: Illegal eviction by a landlord, An antisocial behaviour injunction, Not able to make a homeless application, Disrepair where there is a serious risk of harm to health and safety, A possession hearing or an eviction (other than mortgage possession).

Shelters.title: Shelter - North East
Shelters.info: Specialist face to face advice on housing and an in-house solicitor. Dealing with a range of issues, including homelessness, evictions, repossessions, rent arrears.

Shelters.title: Shelter - Thames Valley
Shelters.info: Specialist help in housing related matters for anyone who is homeless or has a housing related problem. Subjects covered include disrepair, rent/mortgage arrears, illegal eviction, harassment, housing benefit, repossession and landlord/tenant disputes.

Shelters.title: Shelter - West Midlands
Shelters.info: Specialist advice and information on housing. Issues covered include homelessness, rent/mortgage arrears, housing benefit, private renting problems. Specialist housing advice for other agencies whose clients have housing problems. Drop-in for new clients Monday - Friday 9am - 5pm. Outreach services at Dudley CAB on a Monday, at West Bromwich CAB on a Friday. National helpline 0808 800 4444.

Shelters.title: Shelter Housing Aid and Research Project (SHARP)
Shelters.info: Advice and advocacy on housing rights and options. Solicitor for legal advice and help at court. Training, consultancy and information for other agencies on housing law and rights.

Shelters.title: SHP Tenancy Support Lambeth
Shelters.info: Advice for people living in LB Lambeth on benefits, housing, homelessness, debt and repairs.

Shelters.title: Shrewsbury Homes for All
Shelters.info: Advice and information for people aged over 25 with housing problems. Advice on homelessness, finding accommodation, housing rights and benefits. Tenancy support. Advice on obtaining rent in advance, rent accounts with private landlords, bond scheme.

Shelters.title: Shropshire Housing Alliance - Shrewsbury
Shelters.info: Advice and information for people who are homeless, or inadequately or inappropriately housed. Advice on finding accommodation, housing rights, benefits, drugs, health and money/debt. Also run a bedsit scheme for young people and offer ongoing support to people of all ages.

Shelters.title: Simon on the Streets
Shelters.info: Street based services working with people with issues around rough sleeping and also have complex needs and are not using/accessing other services. Advice and support with emergency accommodation, signposting to other services.

Shelters.title: Smart Works
Shelters.info: Help for disadvantaged women to take up employment opportunities through the provision of professional attire. Women are provided with a suit (and, if necessary, accessories) appropriate for an interview. Additional clothing is available once the client has found a job. Also offer mentoring for women returning to work, workshops on interview techniques, CVs and applications, motivation skills.

Shelters.title: SOLO Housing (East Anglia)
Shelters.info: Aims to provide access to suitable, secure and affordable accommodation, through a register of lodgings for single people who are or are in danger of becoming homeless and by providing supported accommodation for single people with support needs.

Shelters.title: South Gloucestershire Deposit Bond Scheme
Shelters.info: Help homeless people access private rented sector accommodation by providing a rent deposit of up to one month's rent. General housing advice for people using the scheme.

Shelters.title: South Tyneside Churches Key Project
Shelters.info: Advice and mediation services for young people experiencing hardship and who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Services include tenant floating support, homelessness prevention services, mediation, peer education and the provision of emergency support packs.

Shelters.title: SPACES (Single Persons Accommodation Centre for the Ex-Services)
Shelters.info: Helpline for single people leaving any of the armed services with no permanent home to go to. Housing advice and help finding accommodation anywhere in the UK. Assessments carried out by phone or face-to-face. Can also offer ongoing support with moving to new accommodation, becoming homeless again or issues arising with subsequent accommodation.

Shelters.title: Spelthorne Rentstart
Shelters.info: Advice and information on finding accommodation and on going tenancy support for single people and childless couples to access accommodation in the private rented sector. Also offer a range of services to landlords, including a Deposit Guarantee scheme and on going tenancy support.

Shelters.title: Springfield Community Flat
Shelters.info: Advice and support for vulnerable people living in Lambeth and surrounding areas. Services include advice of debt, benefits, finding work, housing problems and advice for asylum seekers and other migrants. Offer assistance in accessing legal advice and medical help. Creche with early years sessional care, breakfast club and after school club for primary age children. ESOL and literacy classes.

Shelters.title: St Martins Housing Trust - CAPS Team
Shelters.info: Contact, assessment and prevention service providing street outreach services and drop-in advice for single homeless people aged 18 and over. Help with finding accommodation, homelessness applications, GP registration, referral to drug and alcohol and other support services. Help with getting ID. Advice surgery also at Norwich City Council offices.

Shelters.title: St Mungo's - Bristol Outreach Team
Shelters.info: Works on the streets to engage rough sleepers and support them to secure accommodation.

Shelters.title: St Vincent Support Centre
Shelters.info: Advice, support, signposting and referrals for individuals and families on low incomes or benefits, including people with mental health problems. Casework in debt. Basic skills education. Clothing and furniture store. General counselling. Community cafe.

Shelters.title: Staffs & West Midlands Community Rehabilitation - Housing Advice Unit
Shelters.info: Information and advice to help offenders meet their housing needs. Practical help and support to find and secure suitable accommodation in the community.

Shelters.title: Stonewall Housing Advice Line
Shelters.info: Telephone advice and information for lesbians, gay men, bisexual and transgender people on homelessness, housing options, harassment and finding accommodation. Also, offer casework and tenancy support. Housing advice drop-in service on the 3rd Thursday of every month 5-7pm at Wood Green Library.

Shelters.title: Stonham Signpost Service
Shelters.info: Advice service for people with housing problems, including signposting to accommodation and counselling services.

Shelters.title: Street Homeless Prevention Team
Shelters.info: Support service for street homeless people and those at risk of imminent street homelessness, working predominantly in the community via street outreach and in day centres. Referrals to hostels and housing projects, befriending, support around the risk of eviction, support for entrenched street homeless people.

Shelters.title: Surrey Care Trust
Shelters.info: Provides a range of services for vulnerable people in Surrey. Alternative education and training programmes for young people and adults. A community boat offering day time boat trips to disadvantaged and vulnerable people from Surrey community groups in the summer months, and in the winter offering offenders serving community orders skills development by doing environmental work. Crisis grants.

Shelters.title: Sussex Central YMCA - Youth Advice Centre
Shelters.info: Single point of access for 16-25 year olds who need housing advice, are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Advice on housing options, finding accommodation & tenants rights. Specialist private rented drop-in offering support in securing a tenancy. Relocation assistance. Mediation for families & young people aged 14-17. 9am-12pm Monday to Friday for housing advice. General advice 3pm-6pm

Shelters.title: T.h.o.m.a.s. Organisation
Shelters.info: Provides a range of services for people who have issues with drug or alcohol misuse. Services include drop-in centre, residential rehabilitation, support and mentoring for ex-offenders, tenancy support and aftercare.

Shelters.title: The Bond Board
Shelters.info: Rent deposit scheme which enables people who are homeless and on a low income to gain access to private rented accommodation. Landlords are issued with a written guarantee (non-cash contract). Ongoing signposting advice and support. Enquiries and issuing of bonds dealt with by Housing Advice, 1 Silverwell Lane, Bolton BL1 1QN, phone 01204 335900 for details.

Shelters.title: The Bridge
Shelters.info: Five key services: housing advice and supported tenancy team; mediation service enabling people to resolve disputes that may lead to housing difficulties and/or homelessness; education project raises awareness of homelessness in local colleges; plus access to a range of homelessness services.

Shelters.title: The Bridge Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for the local community. Affordable meals, second hand clothes, leisure activities, volunteering opportunities. Signposting to welfare rights advice. Contact The Bridge Centre for Lettings Opportunities.

Shelters.title: The Hope Centre
Shelters.info: Provides a range of prevention services for people at risk of homelessness through the provision of advice, life skills training, advocacy, support, guidance and training. Services include information and advice around employment and training. Help with job searches, CV and interview preparation. IT courses and access. Self-confidence and assertiveness courses. Proof of identity service.

Shelters.title: The Housing Link
Shelters.info: Advice and support for people (aged 16+) who are homeless, potentially homeless or badly housed. Range of temporary supported accommodation. Further office at Castlecroft House, 29 Castlecroft Road, Bury.

Shelters.title: The RendezVous
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for young people aged 13-25 providing advice, information and guidance on health, social, educational and work-related issues. Housing and benefits support and links to specialist support. Mentoring and individual tutoring (Level 2 qualifications) available. Young parents support group (Wednesdays 12.30 ? 2.30) . Facilities include coffee bar, free wifi, sound recording studio.

Shelters.title: Threshold Barnet Centre
Shelters.info: Advice and casework for homeless people and people with housing problems, including those considered to be 'low priority'. Housing advice and rent deposit scheme drop-in at Barnet House, 1255 High Road, Whetstone N20 0EJ.

Shelters.title: Trinity Housing Resource Centre
Shelters.info: Advice on debt, money, benefits and housing. Subjects covered include rent and mortgage arrears, council tax arrears, credit card debt, catalogue debt, utility bills. Housing advice including homelessness, disrepair and transfer applications. Advice and information on all welfare benefits. ESOL classes. Employment workshops. Internet cafe.

Shelters.title: Truro Foyer Streetwise Project
Shelters.info: Support for young people (up to age 19) who are homeless or at risk of homelessness. Mentoring support around finding and applying for accommodation, including support around applying for accommodation under Section 17 and 20 of the Housing Act for 16 and 17 year olds, and accessing any appropriate and relevant services.

Shelters.title: WDGB Limited
Shelters.info: Provide deposit guarantee bonds for single people and childless couples (aged 18-65) who are homeless or in housing need. Deposit guarantee bonds enable people to access private rented accommodation. Please note that the Charity only assists local people ? i.e. people who have been resident in North Somerset for the last six months.

Shelters.title: Wearside Women in Need
