Shelters.info: Advice, support and safe accommodation for women and children experiencing sexual, physical or emotional abuse. Helpline, drop-in and outreach advice services. Furniture and clothing store. Supported housing, including schemes for homeless young people aged 16-18 who have experienced sexual abuse and women with mental health problems. Programmes for male perpetrators of domestic violence.

Shelters.title: Wellington and District YMCA - Thrive
Shelters.info: Floating support for a range of issues including signposting to education, health services, support with drug & alcohol misuse, finance and budgeting, tenancy support (regardless of tenure) through the Thrive partnership. Wellington and District YMCA specialize in drug and alcohol misuse support via the Thrive floating support service. Clients can self refer or be referred through another agency.

Shelters.title: Whitehaven Community Trust
Shelters.info: Self-development, training, social welfare and counselling on health issues for young people aged 16-25. Training in job search skills and self-development. Commercial pottery and arts and crafts centre. Community coffee shop run by young people. Healthy living centre. Hostel for homeless 16-24 year olds. Move on Trainer Flats from April 2013

Shelters.title: Yorkshire and Humberside Reconnections Team
Shelters.info: Works with people from the A8 and A2 countries who are sleeping rough/at risk of sleeping rough and who wish to return to their original communities. Assistance with temporary travel documents, travel arrangements from the UK to home country, escorting to embassy appointments and stations where necessary. Can arrange interim accommodation while transport and documents are being sorted out.

Shelters.title: Young Devon - Newton Abbot Youth Enquiry Service
Shelters.info: Advice, information and counselling for young people aged 13-25. Advice on accommodation, budgeting, benefits and sexual health, including free condoms and pregnancy testing. Housing and support for 16-25 year olds, including supported housing and floating support for those living independently. Supported lodgings. Mediation with families, landlords or other agencies.

Shelters.title: Youth Advice Centre (YAC)
Shelters.info: Drop-in advice Monday-Thursday 3pm-6pm. Housing advice and resettlement service Thursdays 3pm-6pm. Sexual health nurse available Tuesday 3pm-5.30pm. Wellbeing worker Monday 3pm-6pm.

Shelters.title: Bedford Concern for the Homeless and Rootless (BECHAR)
Shelters.info: Drop-in day centre for homeless people and people aged 16+ needing support. Shelter, hot food, showers, laundry, clothing and general goods store. Advice and help with housing, benefits and personal finance. Support and referrals for substance misusers. Medical room. Social activities. A range of satellite clinics are run at the premises - call for schedule and details.

Shelters.title: Centre 33 (St Albans) Limited
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for people (18+) who are socially or materially disadvantaged , including homeless people, people with mental health or substance dependency problems or people who are lonely or socially isolated. Free meals with tea, coffee or soft drink. Shower (toiletries and towels provided). Some second hand clothes.

Shelters.title: DENS Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day Centre for single homeless people providing a hot meal, showers, advice and support. Help with finding accommodation. Onward referral to drug, alcohol and other support services. One-to-one support by appointment.

Shelters.title: First Stop Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for people in need, including homeless people, ex-offenders, unemployed people and single parents. Showers, low cost breakfast and lunch. Signposting to emergency and longer term housing. Pre-tenancy, resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Basic skills, ESOL, IT classes. Support around job search, CV writing and interview techniques. Benefits advice. Counselling. Needle exchange.

Shelters.title: HARP Southend - Bradbury Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre homeless people providing a range of services. Free food, laundry, showers. Resource centre. Housing and benefits advice. Rough sleeper basic support including sleeping bags and flasks. On-site medical services. Advice around finding/keeping accommodation. Advice on where to seek assistance from other agencies. Access to emergency over night accommodation.

Shelters.title: Ipswich Housing Action Group
Shelters.info: Range of services for single homeless people. Provides temporary accommodation and move-on support for people moving into independent accommodation; advice on housing rights, homelessness and finding accommodation; debt, money and welfare rights advice. Street outreach.

Shelters.title: Ipswich Housing Action Group - Chapman Centre
Shelters.info: Provides a walk-in advice and support to marginalised and vulnerable people over 18 on a wide range of issues, such as housing, welfare benefits, money advice, access to drug & alcohol and health issues, including people who are homeless and/or rough sleeping via an Outreach service based at the Centre.  Service Users have access to computers, shower facilities, phones, post collection, lunches, clothing and food parcels. The Centre also provides meaningful activities by supporting them in their journey back into social inclusion - through structured training sessions in dental awareness, budgeting skills, basic cooking skills, volunteering.

Shelters.title: New Hope - Rough Sleeping Prevention Service
Shelters.info: Support centre for those who are rough sleeping and sofa surfing providing a cooked breakfast and take away lunch. Showers and laundry facilities available. One to one support available including initial assessment, support, advice and referrals to appropriate accommodation. Access to primary health care.

Shelters.title: NOAH Enterprise (New Opportunities and Horizons) - Welfare Centre
Shelters.info: Range of services for homeless people. Welfare centre providing food, clothing, showers, medical care, counselling, accommodation search, financial advice. Outreach support. Training - accredited carpentry, basic and life skills. Social enterprise - furniture renovation, refurbished white goods and restored/new furniture for sale. Work experience opportunities for long term unemployed people.

Shelters.title: North Herts Sanctuary
Shelters.info: Housing related Support and advice and referrals to agencies for treatment options. Advice on housing, benefits and related issues. Support and assistance for families and friends. 17-bed nightshelter based on same site. No pets allowed.

Shelters.title: Open Door St Albans Drop-in
Shelters.info: Drop-in service for homeless and vulnerably housed people aged 18 and over. Resettlement help, counselling and access to a nurse.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army - Pottergate ARC
Shelters.info: Drop-in day centre for rough sleepers, homeless people & people housed without support. Showers, food, clothing store. Access to specialist services including health assessments, mental health workers, preventative homeless workers, medical & drug & alcohol help. Jobsearch facilities. Drop-in and breakfast 8am - 10am. Lunch 12.30pm-1pm. Afternoon appts Mon, Tues, Weds and Thurs 2pm-3.30pm.

Shelters.title: Streets 2 Homes
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre offering a wrap-around service for homeless and vulnerably housed people providing social contact, assistance with basic needs and access to housing, employment and general advice, health services, food (50p for cooked meal), toiletries and clothing. Assistance with finding accommodation, homeless prevention and tenancy sustainment advice.

Shelters.title: Wintercomfort for the Homeless
Shelters.info: Learning and development service for people who are homeless or vulnerably housed. Support with education and training, volunteering and leisure activities. Showers, laundry, clothing, breakfast and representatives from other support services from 8.30am - 10am. Two social enterprises offering employment and training in cleaning and the catering industry. See website for information on activities.

Shelters.title: Anchor Centre
Shelters.info: Wet centre for street drinkers. Housing advice, including referrals to emergency and longer term housing, pre-tenancy support. general activities programme. Lounge, coffee bar, TV. Phone, internet access. Showers, Lunch mon, wed fri and breakfast club 830-930

Shelters.title: Base 51
Shelters.info: Drop-in for young people, including those who are homeless, sleeping rough, excluded from school & ex-offenders. Nurse prescriber clinics based at centre. Contraception & sexual health advice. Showers, laundry, clothing and counselling is offered

Shelters.title: Centrepoint Outreach
Shelters.info: Day centre for people who are homeless or socially or economically excluded. Housing advice, including onward referrals to other agencies for further support. General benefits advice. Showers, laundry, clothing store. Snacks, food parcels. Furniture and household goods supply for re-use. Acts435 advocacy.

Shelters.title: Daylight Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for homeless people and other vulnerable adults. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Pre-tenancy, resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Support around life skills, meaningful occupation and employment. Showers, clothing store. Referrals to food bank. Lunch, tea and coffee. Access to phones, computers and the internet.

Shelters.title: Emmanuel House
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless and vulnerable people. General advice and support, referrals to specialist agencies. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Housing advice, including pre-tenancy, resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Help with jobsearch. Sessions with nurse, chiropodist and mental health outreach team. Showers, laundry, clothing store, meals. IT suite, access to phones.

Shelters.title: Hope
Shelters.info: Day service for homeless people, rough sleepers and those in unsuitable accommodation or on low incomes. Showers, laundry, clothing store. Breakfast and lunch. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Housing advice from specialist staff, pre-tenancy support. Local drugs agency run sessions. IT classes, advice on benefits and debt.

Shelters.title: Leicester YMCA
Shelters.info: Range of services for homeless people and for the local community. Services include advice and support, help with finding accommodation, life skills training, youth groups and playschemes.

Shelters.title: Northampton Jesus Centre - Step Up
Shelters.info: Day centre for people who are homeless or marginalized and those with mental health issues. Offers showers, laundry, clothing store, luggage storage, cheap food, free tea/coffee and sandwiches and lots more. Housing advice, including referrals to emergency and longer term housing and pre-tenancy support. Range of educational courses, ESOL, cooking and budgeting support. Help with form filling.

Shelters.title: Padley Homeless - Day Centre
Shelters.info: Drop in centre for people aged 18 and above who are homeless, rough sleeping, destitute, disadvantaged or need support to maintain their accommodation. 10 units of accommodation for males aged 18 and above. Advice, information and support are available around housing issues, drug/alcohol use, mental health and general needs, along with referrals to other appropriate agencies.

Shelters.title: Pathways Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless and vulnerably housed. Provide support in areas of housing, benefits advice, money skills coaching, accessing training, employment and education. Links with local floating support teams for resettlement and tenancy support. Nurse available on site. Monthly visits from a Dentist. Food, emergency clothing.

Shelters.title: The Centre Place
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for vulnerable young people, particularly homeless people or in housing need. Referrals to emergency & longer term housing. Pre-tenancy, resettlement & tenancy sustainment support. Healthy eating & cooking on a budget sessions. Support with applying for jobs, CV writing & job search. Young parents support group. Counselling. Showers, laundry. Lunch Tues, evening meal Thurs.

Shelters.title: The Centre Project (Leicester)
Shelters.info: Day centre for isolated people run by the Central Baptist Church. Offers a place to meet others, information, practical support, games, cheap meals and drinks, access to computers and the internet. Drop-in and social activities Tuesday, Thursday and Friday 3pm - 5pm. ESOL classes.

Shelters.title: The Friary
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for homeless and unemployed people. Advice on issues around housing, debt and benefits. Food parcels, bedding, clothing. Showers, laundry and barber. Homeless health team, including GP and nurse. Dentistry, optometry and chiropody. Support around substance misuse issues. Hepatitis A and B vaccinations, HIV and hepatitis C tests. Social activities. IT suite.

Shelters.title: YASC - The Y Advice and Support Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless people, including rough sleepers, hostel residents and those who are vulnerably housed. Housing advice, including pre-tenancy support, access to resettlement/tenancy sustainment support and to street outreach team. GP surgery including alcohol and drugs worker. Mental health team. Showers, laundry, clothing for rough sleepers. Breakfast until 9am.

Shelters.title: 240 Project
Shelters.info: Activity centre for ex-homeless people who have been resettled in the area (especially those at risk of losing their tenancies), and for people who are vulnerable or excluded. Social activities, weekly workshops in drama, art, music, poetry, cooking. Free lunch Monday-Wednesday. Motivational group. Peer to peer education. Adult literacy.

Shelters.title: Ace of Clubs
Shelters.info: Day centre for the homeless, vulnerable and others in need. Cheap meals, access to physical and mental health care, laundry, shower facilities. Advice on benefits and housing Monday-Friday. Advice on finding accommodation. Welfare advice. IT Suite with basic computing lessons and internet café sessions for online benefit claims and job searches. Food & safety classes.

Shelters.title: Action for Children - Bayswater Families Centre
Shelters.info: Support for vulnerable families in Westminster who are homeless, in temporary accommodation or threatened with homelessness, families who have experienced domestic abuse or those needing parenting or employability support. Drop-in Advice for those affected by Welfare Benefit reforms - Tuesday 1pm-3pm. Play and crèche sessions for parents and children attending the centre.

Shelters.title: Acton Homeless Concern
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless people. lunch Tues-Fri, Sun & some Mons. Clothes, showers. Advice on benefits and housing. GP Fri, chiropody, optician, dentist and barber. Alcohol and drug counsellor. Women and children's group Weds. Damien Centre at 3-5 Church Road, Acton W3 8PU - (offer breakfast) Mon to Fri 8am-6pm, for social activities, TV, tea, coffee and sandwiches.

Shelters.title: Archway Drop-In Centre
Shelters.info: Weekly drop-in for homeless people and those who are socially isolated or lonely, offering food (light snacks, tea, soup, sandwiches), a change of clothes and somewhere to spend time. Limited counselling, advice and information also available. Entrance costs 50 pence.

Shelters.title: Ashford Place
Shelters.info: Ashford Place is a community resource centre. Our main areas of support are Housing (for those with a connection to Brent only), Training, Employment & Enterprise, Substance Misuse Services, Community Engagement. Resettlement, supported housing, tenancy sustainment. Basic skills, work skills and vocational training. Welfare benefits advice.

Shelters.title: Barons Court Project
Shelters.info: Day centre for people vulnerable due to mental ill-health and/or homelessness. Tenancy sustainment support. Cost-price cafe, laundry and shower facilities available on drop-in days. Life skills training Thursday 2pm-5pm. Women's Group Fri 12 noon-2pm. Green Palm Club (BME social group) Fri 2.30pm-5pm. Activities throughout the week such as drama, relaxation, computer sessions and quizzes.

Shelters.title: Cardboard Citizens
Shelters.info: Homeless people's professional theatre company. Runs a range of workshops at Crisis Skylight in drama, dance, music, creative writing and circus skills for homeless people. In addition provides employment and training support for homeless people. Tours Forum Theatre production each year, which goes out to hostels, prisons day centres to engage with the service users. Also run workshops at the hub.

Shelters.title: Cardinal Hume Centre - Advice Service
Shelters.info: Local advice service for anyone who is homeless or needs help. We provide advice and support on benefits, money management, housing, immigration, substance misuse and domestic violence. Register at the Medway Street entrance to access the Centre's services; Coaching and mentoring, IT, Basic skills, English language classes employment support, family learning and access early years nursery places.

Shelters.title: Cardinal Hume Centre - Family Centre
Shelters.info: Ofsted registered Early Years Nursery offers 15 hours of free childcare in South Westminster each week (9:15am ? 4pm) for 3-5 year olds. Crèche is available for parents wanting to access other services on-site ? advice and support on benefits, money management, housing, immigration, domestic violence, coaching and mentoring, IT, Basic skills, English classes, employment support.

Shelters.title: Chelsea Methodist Church Pastoral Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in for homeless people open Mon, Tues and Thurs 9am-2pm. Women only drop-in Wednesday 3pm - 5pm. Showers, Laundry and Advice. Free meals 1pm. GP fortnightly Tues pm.

Shelters.title: Crisis Skylight - London
Shelters.info: Activity centre for homeless and non-homeless people. Range of workshops including arts, bicycle repairs, gardening, yoga. Education programme offering ESOL, IELTs, ECDL and basic skills. Opportunities to develop new or existing skills, socialise and integrate with the general public. Employment services team. Housing advice. Counselling and optician services. Signposting to other services.

Shelters.title: Deptford Reach
Shelters.info: Day centre for adults who are vulnerable through homelessness, mental health, loneliness, severe poverty. Low cost meals, free tea/coffee/soup. Clothing store, shower, laundry facilities, access to health care onsite, health and wellbeing, Housing advice, resettlement support. Literacy, numeracy, IT classes. Training, educational, employment support. Leisure activities. Private Rented Scheme.

Shelters.title: Divine Rescue
Shelters.info: Provides a range of support services for people who are homeless or vulnerable including people with substance abuse problems, ex-offenders and sex workers. Free breakfasts, clothes and counselling sessions (appointment only). Advice and information on housing and hostel referrals, support with form filling. Detox support. Volunteering opportunities.

Shelters.title: Doorstep Homeless Families Project
Shelters.info: Services for homeless families with children who have been placed in hostels and other temporary accommodation. Play and creative activities for under 5s, laundry facilities, toy library, health sessions, arts and crafts, various classes including IT, yoga. Parent support group.

Shelters.title: Dunloe Centre
Shelters.info: Weekly drop-in centre for homeless people offering free food - hot meal and tea. Toiletries, bedding and small domestic items sometimes available. Rough sleepers will be seen in the first 45 minutes.

Shelters.title: Faith in Action - Homelessness Project Merton
Shelters.info: Twice weekly drop-in for rough sleepers, people who are precariously housed such as squatters, those who are socially excluded, vulnerable and isolated or who have addiction issues. Advice on addictions, benefits, housing, mental health. Listening ear. Breakfast, lunch, showers, laundry, clothing. IT suite for job search.

Shelters.title: Homeless Action in Barnet
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless people and those in insecure housing. Drop-in with lunch served 12 noon-1.30pm. Rough sleepers' free breakfast 9am-10.30 Mon-Fri. Showers, laundry, benefits advice. Referral to training/education. Access to counselling. GP, nurse, chiropodist monthly. Visiting drugs and alcohol worker. Tenancy support.

Shelters.title: London Irish Centre - Welfare Services Department
Shelters.info: Community and welfare service for newly arrived and settled Irish people. Advice on housing, employment, benefits, pensions, access to mainstream services, help getting ID. Resettlement support for young people (16-24). Showers and free clothing. Alcohol counselling and assessment. Cultural and social activities. Elders day club, befriending scheme. Abstinence based social club. Elders outreach.

Shelters.title: London Jesus Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in open from 10.15am Mon, Tues, Wed & Fri offering friendship and support for people with housing and other social problems. Provide food and drink, clothing, laundry, showers phone and IT access. Help with finding accommodation and looking for work. 'Works' programme of educational, recreational and social support groups, including IT suite, ESOL and English conversation classes.

Shelters.title: Manna Centre
Shelters.info: Centre for single homeless people and those in need. Housing and welfare advice 9.30am-1.30pm. Free food, clothing and showers. Surgery and visiting nurse Tuesday and Friday 10am-12.30pm. Mental health worker fortnightly Tuesday 10am-1pm. Chiropodist fortnightly. Optician monthly. Osteopath Wednesday 10am-1pm. Jobcentre Plus advice Thursday 9.30am-12 noon. Furniture. ICT. ESOL.

Shelters.title: New Horizon Youth Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for young homeless people. Benefits, housing, careers advice. Laundry/showers/clothes. Free lunch. IT, ESOL, literacy, numeracy, cookery, drama classes. Women only groups. Nurse. Mental health support. Resettlement support. Female sex worker project. Street outreach. Rough sleeper luggage store. Life skills support. Art, gym, sports. Volunteer project. Drugs & Alcohol support. prison

Shelters.title: North London Action for the Homeless
Shelters.info: Drop-in day centre for local homeless and vulnerable people offering free food (three course vegetarian meal). Welfare rights adviser. Free clothing when available. Regular visits from a health access worker. Fortnightly visit from Greenlight mobile health clinic. English for Speakers of Other Languages (especially Polish) on Thursday.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army - Regent Hall Homelessness Services
Shelters.info: Range of support services for homeless people aged 18+, primarily rough sleepers. Advice, signposting, recreational activities and individual key work appointments. Some clothing. Hot meal during Wednesday drop-in 5.30 - 8pm. Service users can call in any time during opening hours to make an appointment. Advice and enquiries Mon, Tues, Weds, Fri 2.30pm-4pm. Weds, advisors afternoon/ soup kitchen

Shelters.title: Siloam Community Services
Shelters.info: Community Café and Drop-in service for the homeless, those threatened with homelessness, and those in financial difficulty on Tuesday 10am and 2pm providing a range of low cost hot/ cold snacks, drinks, and light lunches. Information, advice guidance and emergency support, food parcels. Also provide each a free 3-course meal on Tuesday evenings.

Shelters.title: Spitalfields Crypt Trust - Shoreditch Community Project
Shelters.info: Day centre for people who are homeless, isolated or vulnerable. Most users are sleeping rough or living in temporary accommodation. Basic housing advice and referrals to longer term housing. Signposting and help with form filling. Links with Thames Reach Street Rescue Team. Drop-in Tues and Weds at St Leonard's Church, Shoreditch E1 6JN and Thurs and Fri at the TAB Centre, 3 Godfry Place, E2

Shelters.title: St Cuthbert's Drop-In Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for people who are rough sleepers, homeless, marginalised, isolated, unemployed or have mental health or substance misuse problems. Advice on housing, referrals to emergency housing and specialist services, including local substance use and mental health services. Brief crisis counselling. Free shower, laundry, clothing store. Low cost breakfast and lunch Mon-Fri. Internet access.

Shelters.title: The Manna
Shelters.info: Drop-in for homeless and marginalised people, offering friendship, advice and support. Evening meals are offered Tuesday, lunch on Wednesday. Alcohol & drugs worker & access to health services. Clothes store, showers, washing machine & tumble drier (£1 per wash). Various activities, including gardening, cooking classes, womens group, art, choir, table tennis, pool, poetry group & cookery classes.

Shelters.title: The Marylebone Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless women, including refugees and asylum seekers. Rough-Sleepers Drop-in only. General access to women (Mon-Fri 9.30-1.30pm) only if signed to attend a course/workshop or 1:1 session. Sign posting service. Showers (Mon-Fri), Laundry (Mon-Fri), Clothing Store (Tue and Thu 10.00-12.00pm). Breakfast (Mon-Fri upon food availability). Women into Work.

Shelters.title: The Passage Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless people. Advice on housing, benefits, health, alcohol, drugs. Help with rehousing. Open learning centre for literacy, computer skills. Weekly careers guidance. Nurse Mon-Fri 9.30am-1pm, GP Mon, Weds, Fri, chiropodist Tues. Drop-in Mon-Fri 8am-10am breakfast, 12 noon-1.30pm lunch, Sat, Sun 9am-12 noon snacks. Showers, laundry, clothing store. Afternoon group. Street outreach.

Shelters.title: The Spires Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless and disadvantaged people. Rough sleeper space open to anyone who is rough sleeping.  Project staff support, advice and accommodation referrals available and specialist external agency support.   Breakfast, showers and clothing available. Open Access Drop-in (Tuesday 10:30am - 2pm) - project staff support, advice and referrals available.  Range of specialist external agency support available, i.e. nurse, Jobcentre Plus, legal advice. Refreshments and lunch. Women only space offering support to vulnerable women of all ages Monday and Friday 11am - 1:30pm.

Shelters.title: The Upper Room
Shelters.info: Support for homeless people, those who are isolated, lonely or marginalised, ex-offenders, those persistently excluded by other services. free food: Evening meal Monday-Friday 5.30pm-6.45pm. Informal counselling in English and Polish/referrals needed for that service

Shelters.title: The Welcome Centre
Shelters.info: Day Centre for rough sleepers and vulnerable adults, based in Ilford, practical support of hot meals, laundry service, showers, clothing. Rough sleepers breakfast Weds & Fri 9-10am. Information and on a range of issues, including housing, drugs and alcohol, benefits & immigration. Nurse led clinic that deals with all health and mental health issues. Life Skills programme. Recreational activities.

Shelters.title: Vineyard Community Centre
Shelters.info: Morning drop-in for people who are in crisis or homeless. Offer clothing, showers, food and signposting to other agencies, solicitors, drug and alcohol teams and benefit advisors. Afternoon community cafe, Monday-Thursday 12.30-4.30pm.

Shelters.title: Webber Street
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless people. Free tea/coffee and breakfast 9.30am-10am Monday to Thursday and Saturday. Doors open at 9am when tea/coffee is available. Showers and clothing store. Film club on Tuesday afternoon. START team every other Thursday. Nurse available 1 morning a week. Advice service on a Friday morning.

Shelters.title: West London Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless people 25+. Housing, benefits, substance misuse advice. Advice appts 11.45am-12.45pm. Referrals to housing providers. Counselling. Nurse daily, GP Tuesdays. Cheap food, laundry, showers, clothing, restricted left luggage store, mail address service. Video club TV room. Drop-in for rough sleepers Mon-Fri 9am-11.30am.

Shelters.title: Whitechapel Mission
Shelters.info: Day centre for people who are homeless or in need. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Signposting to resettlement services and to mental health, alcohol and drugs services. Life skills centre offers support around everyday living, including basic skills classes. Women only group Friday 12 noon-3.30pm. Showers, clothing store. Breakfast.

Shelters.title: Women at the Well
Shelters.info: Women-only drop-in centre for women with a complex range of needs relating to street based prostitution, offending & anti-social behaviour, problematic drug and alcohol abuse, rough sleeping & trafficking. Advice on housing, benefits, sexual health. Support around substance use and literacy. Counselling. Hot meals, laundry facilities, shower. Massage, acupuncture. Music therapy. Internet access.

Shelters.title: Basis@336
Shelters.info: Resource centre for anyone needing housing support. Advice on finding accommodation. Referrals and signposting to other services. Showers, laundry, emergency food, befriending and Internet access. Access to support around accessing private rented sector, including rent in advance and deposit scheme, follow-up support once tenancy has been found. Emergency accommodation for rough sleepers.

Shelters.title: Changing Lives Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless and vulnerable people. General advice and support. Housing advice, including referrals to emergency and longer term housing, pre-tenancy, resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Drugs worker based onsite, mental health outreach team visit weekly. Alcohol Care Treatment Service on Monday mornings. Showers, laundry, clothing store. Breakfast, lunch.

Shelters.title: Crisis Skylight - Newcastle
Shelters.info: Education, training and employment centre for homeless and vulnerably housed people. Classes in IT, art, creative writing, meditation and yoga. Training opportunities for homeless people at the Skylight cafe next door.

Shelters.title: First Stop Darlington
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for anyone in need, mainly homeless people and young people. Housing advice, including referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Life skills classes. Phone, computers and internet access. Showers, laundry, clothing store.

Shelters.title: People's Kitchen
Shelters.info: Provide free food and friendship for homeless people. Based at the Alison Centre Tuesday, Wednesday and Friday 6.30pm-8.30pm, Thursday 1pm-4.30pm. Showers, clothing store, lunch Thursday, evening meal Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday. Street outreach and food at Trafalgar Street Monday 9pm-10pm and Thursday 8pm, Eldon Square Sunday 9am-10am, Elswick Cemetery Sunday 10am-11am.

Shelters.title: Barnabus - Beacon Drop-in Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-ins services for rough sleepers and homeless people. English, Maths and IT classes. Help  those sleeping rough to secure shelter, obtain ID, assist with benefits, housing, and connect to training for employment.

Shelters.title: Booth Centre
Shelters.info: Advice and activity centre for single homeless people. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Sessions with specialist outreach staff. Pre-tenancy, resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Outreach worker from local GP surgery, CAT team available on request. Range of classes, including drama, music, film, sports and support to get back into work.

Shelters.title: Chester Aid to the Homeless - Harold Tomlins Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless & vulnerable people. Low cost food, clothing, numeracy, literacy & computer courses. Personal development and lottery funded supported courses daily. Shared houses with management support. Medical suite with visiting doctor, district nurse, volunteer counsellor available.

Shelters.title: Foxton Centre and Street Outreach Team
Shelters.info: Day time Community Café for rough sleepers, street drinkers and other homeless adults. Offers eight pathways to health and wellbeing including intensive support, job club, allotment, service user committee, volunteering opportunities and the Market Stall project. Street outreach team working with people sleeping rough in Preston 3 days a week, rough sleeper count/outreach every fortnight.

Shelters.title: Furness Homeless Support Group - Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless people. Showers, laundry, clothing store. Lunch, tea and coffee. Phone and computing facilities. Supported accommodation via CHAP referrals, referrals to longer term accommodation. Referrals to Pre-tenancy, resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Referrals to specialist agencies for support around substance misuse and mental health.

Shelters.title: Help the Homeless (Chorley)
Shelters.info: Information and advocacy for people aged 16+ who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Food and an household effects. Young person and family mediation and counselling offered.

Shelters.title: Hope House Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre providing support for people who are homeless or at risk of homelessness, people who have or who have had drug/alcohol misuse issues and people with mild mental health issues. Breakfast club Mon-Fri. Access to showers, laundry facilities and donated clothing store. Advice and advocacy around benefits, finding accommodation and accessing a range of health and substance misuse services.

Shelters.title: Lancaster and District Homeless Action Service (LDHAS)
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for homeless people and those with housing related problems. Housing advice, including referrals to accommodation, pre-tenancy, resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Weekday morning activities. Maths, English, life skills, confidence building 11.15-12.15pm. Cookery class Weds 2-4pm. Access to phone, computers and internet. Showers, laundry, clothing store. Breakfast. Lunch.

Shelters.title: Manna House
Shelters.info: Drop-in and support centre for people who are homeless or vulnerable. Advice, advocacy and support with benefits, finding accommodation and form filling. Education, life skills, cooking, gardening, IT and budgeting activities. Skills cafe. Hot food, snacks, tea, coffee. Rent deposit scheme. Mentoring and befriending. Chaplaincy for spiritual support.

Shelters.title: Middleton Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless and disadvantaged people. Housing advice including referrals to accommodation, pre-tenancy, resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Benefits advice. Support around budgeting and cooking. Sessions with drug and alcohol teams. Showers, laundry, clothing store, breakfast, and dinner.

Shelters.title: Nightsafe - Platform 5
Shelters.info: Day centre for young homeless people aged 16-24. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. 5-bed nightshelter onsite. Basic skills and health education sessions. Life skills classes, including cooking, budgeting and healthy eating. Help with job search and CV writing. Laundry, showers. Lunch (small charge), tea and coffee.

Shelters.title: Oasis Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for the local community in East Manchester. Community support team providing information and signposting. Getting Ready for Work scheme. Debt counselling. Cookery and art workshops. Computer workshop with one-to-one tuition. Clothing and household goods at affordable prices. Cafe with free breakfast and lunch. Emergency food packs for those in desperate need. Children's play area.

Shelters.title: Petrus Hub
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless and socially excluded people. Breakfast provided 9am-10am. Laundry facilities, bath and shower facilities, clothing store. Advice on housing. Groups including cooking, women's group, reading. Job club. Information and advice to help users access other services.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army - Bootle Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for people in need, including homeless people and people with mental health problems, alcohol or drug problems, ex-offenders, single parents. Provides meals, clothing, signposting for benefits advice, training and education services. Mothers and toddlers groups. Health care. Referral to detox services. Dads Plus Us club every Saturday morning 10am - 12 noon during term time.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army - The Bridge Project
Shelters.info: Range of services for the local community, including a playgroup for under 5s and a widows support group. Day centre for homeless people over the age of 25 (Bridge Project) offering advice on finding accommodation, training and education. Sessions with nurse, drug and alcohol workers, mental health team and local council's rough sleepers team. IT classes. Showers, laundry, clothing store, lunch.

Shelters.title: Streetlife (Blackpool)
Shelters.info: Information, advice, support and counselling for young people who are homeless, at risk of homelessness or who have recently been homeless. Also provide advice and support for young people who have drug, alcohol or mental health issues. 8 bed emergency nightshelter for young people aged 16-25.

Shelters.title: The Basement (Liverpool)
Shelters.info: Daytime & evening drop-in services for people experiencing homelessness or sleeping rough. Access to housing advice, counselling, drug & alcohol support on a drop-in basis. Access to shower & laundry facilities. Education & training programmes onsite & in partnership with local colleges. Street outreach service for street drinkers. Outreach at the Royal Hospital. Residential and detox programme.

Shelters.title: The Brick Homeless Project
Shelters.info: We are a service for homeless and vulnerable people but have moved forward to deal with anyone suffering from financial hardship. We have a triage service where people can still drop in for advice and support and crisis intervention - We now have a fully operational food bank, to access by referral only. We are also point of contact for No Second Night Out for the Wigan.

Shelters.title: The Wellspring
Shelters.info: Resource centre for homeless & disadvantaged people. Housing advice, incl. referrals to emergency accommodation, pre-tenancy, resettlement & tenancy sustainment support. Maths/English classes&computer course. Employment support. Sessions on budgeting. Benefits advice. GP surgery, sessions with nurse. Showers, clothing store. Lunch&Evening meal. Counselling. STI testing. Drug&Alcohol worker onsite

Shelters.title: The Whitechapel Centre
Shelters.info: Rough sleeper enablement centre providing crisis intervention, advice, washing facilities, primary health care, mental health support, daily activity programme and support to find training and employment. No Second Night Out sit up service. Resettlement support. Private Rented Sector Bond Scheme. Supported housing for people with drug, alcohol or mental health issues. Street outreach team.

Shelters.title: Windsor Drop-in Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre offering a communal space with an equipped lounge. Healthy meals, showers and laundry. Free tea, coffee and soup. The centre hosts services provided by the Citizens Advice Bureau and Salford Health Matters - support and advice, doctor's surgery, drug and alcohol clinic, needle exchange, dental treatment. Specialist stop smoking advice and literacy support.

Shelters.title: Wirral Churches Ark Project
Shelters.info: Day centre which is training centre for those homeless and vulnerably housed, in conjunction w/ Crisis Skylight. Controlled drinking environment for the target group of street drinking and can access tea, coffee and light snacks

Shelters.title: Young People's Support Foundation - Manchester City Centre Project
Shelters.info: Resource centre for young people aged 16-25. Homelessness prevention and support, including advice, information, cafe/drop-in, showers, laundry. Groupwork activities, workshops, training and volunteering opportunities. Outreach services and home visits for people unable to call in. Supported housing and resettlement services.

Shelters.title: Aylesbury Homeless Action Group
Shelters.info: Advice and assistance is given for people with housing issues, and those facing homelessness. Opening hours are: Mondays 10.00-11.30 at Aylesbury Job Centre Plus, Wednesdays 10.30-12.00 at St. Mary's Church, Aylesbury, Fridays 12.00-13.00 at Aylesbury Library. Also by appointment only at 2 Rickfords Hill, Aylesbury, HP20 2R.

Shelters.title: Beacon Centre (Banbury)
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for people who are homeless, poorly housed or socially excluded, including those with mental health or substance misuse problems. Referrals to longer term housing. Connection floating support workers available on Monday and Wednesday. Snacks, tea and coffee.

Shelters.title: Caring Hands in the Community
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for homeless people and those who are lonely, marginalised or socially excluded. Provide free food, clothing, shower and laundry facilities. GP sessions, drug and alcohol advice. Assistance with finding accommodation, job search, benefit assessment, computer training. Advocacy, telephone and internet access. All services free of charge.

Shelters.title: Catching Lives - Canterbury Open Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for people who are homeless or in insecure or temporary accommodation. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Housing advice, including resettlement and tenancy sustainment. Mental health nurses daily. Showers, laundry, clothing, breakfast, lunch (free for rough sleepers). Care of address and free telephone use for non personal calls (i.e. regarding benefits, GP, Housing etc).

Shelters.title: CIRDIC - Churches in Reading Drop-In Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for people aged 18+ who are homeless or without secure accommodation. Provides a range of daytime services including free food, clothing, showers. Advice on housing and homelessness and arranges contact with professional agencies. Support around finding employment/meaningful occupation. Allotment. Creative art sessions.

Shelters.title: Clock Tower Sanctuary
Shelters.info: Drop-in advice & support centre for young homeless & insecurely housed people aged 16-25. Signposting to housing, health, education, employment & social services. Drop-in clinics with housing & mental health workers. Access to computers, internet, phones. Storage facilities for rough sleepers. Use of kitchen. Emergency clothing. Washing facilities. Creative workshops, monthly social activities.

Shelters.title: First Base Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for people who are homeless or vulnerably housed. Advice on a range of issues. Sessions with Rough Sleepers Street Services Team. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Signposting to resettlement services and to employment and training agencies. Regular sessions with nurse and chiropodist. Showers, laundry and food available.

Shelters.title: Folkestone Rainbow Centre
Shelters.info: Homeless support service, appointment based provided advice and advocacy with practical support, with referrals to Porchlight and floating support in Kent.

Shelters.title: Friends First - Drop-in Centre
Shelters.info: Weekly evening drop-in for homeless people and people who are lonely or disadvantaged. 12 bed supported house for homeless people. 5 bed supported farmhouse with full-time work traineeship for homeless or long term unemployed people. Fruit and vegetable social enterprise supported by local homeless people.

Shelters.title: Gatehouse (Oxford)
Shelters.info: Early evening drop-in centre for homeless people aged 25+. Free cafe with light refreshments, newspapers, library, phone and internet access. Computer classes. Art group. Writing group. Clothes store. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing.

Shelters.title: House of Mercy -  Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless people (aged 18-65) and people living in inadequate accommodation. Cheap meals, washing facilities, clothing store. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Pre-tenancy, resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Support around budgeting and cooking. Help with letter and CV writing, use of phones. Also run a 7-bed hostel.

Shelters.title: Loose Ends Day Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for people who are homeless, in insecure or temporary housing, unwaged, low waged or travellers. Signposting to local agencies for housing advice. Provide a listening ear. Breakfast Wednesday and Friday. Soup kitchen on Monday. Lunch Sunday and Tuesday. Food parcels. Clothing and bedding store.

Shelters.title: Maidstone Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for single homeless people, including those with alcohol, drug and mental health problems. Help and advice on housing, benefits, alcohol, drugs, mental health. GP service. Full meals and take out food. Washing and laundry facilities. Emergency food parcel on referral from other agencies.

Shelters.title: No Limits - City
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre offering free and confidential information, advice, counselling, support and advocacy for children and young people under 26 years old. Free internet, Telephones, Shower for young people who are homeless, Washing machine for young people who are homeless, Confidential advice, Counselling, Pregnancy testing, Chlamydia screening

Shelters.title: Off the Fence - Project Antifreeze
Shelters.info: Outreach work and drop-in centre providing services to rough sleepers in Brighton and Hove. Cold weather support including sleeping bags, warm clothes, sandwiches and hot drinks. Advice, information and onward referrals to other support services such as hostels and rehabilitation centres. Outreach team works 8pm-10pm on 5 nights a week during winter and 3 nights during summer months.

Shelters.title: Open Door - Conniburrow Drop-In Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in for homeless and vulnerably housed people. Advice on housing and benefits, sessions from external agencies on issues including tenancy support, drug & alcohol misuse, mental health, training & employment. Clothing, toiletries & food provisions when available. Showers. 3 course meal (need to arrive before 12 noon for this). No admittance if under the influence of drugs or alcohol.

Shelters.title: Open Door - Bletchley Drop-In Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in for homeless and vulnerably housed people. Advice on housing and benefits, sessions from external agencies on issues including tenancy support, drug & alcohol misuse, mental health, training & employment. Clothing, toiletries & food provisions when available. Light lunch. No admittance if under the influence of drugs or alcohol.

Shelters.title: Oxford Homeless Pathways - O'Hanlon House Day Service
Shelters.info: Day services for rough sleepers, street drinkers & those who have recently been resettled. Housing advice, including referrals to longer term housing. Pre-tenancy & resettlement support from project's hostel staff. GP surgery and nurse Mon-Fri. Dentist weekly, chiropodist monthly. Harm reduction support, needle exchange. CPN & mental health team weekly. Showers, laundry, clothing, lunch.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army - Eastbourne Citadel
Shelters.info: Provide a range of services for people who are homeless or vulnerable. Services include snacks, showers, advice, activities, courses, access to computers, back to work help, budgeting help and help with form filling. Signposting to other services and drop-ins including health clinic. Tea packs, rolls, showers and advice at the Community Office Monday, Wednesday and Friday 10am-12 noon.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army - Folkestone
Shelters.info: Services for homeless people and others in need in the local community. Breakfast Monday and Friday 8.00am - 9.00am. Access to washing machine (small charge applies). Clothing and furniture available from charity shop after assessment by centre staff. Prison visits. Family tracing service (charges apply).

Shelters.title: Salvation Army - Hastings Citadel
Shelters.info: Centre for the local community including homeless people, elderly people and families. Advice, food parcels. Lunch club. Over 60's club, parent and toddlers group and children's club.

Shelters.title: SHOC (Slough Homeless Our Concern)
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless or vulnerable adults. Advice and assistance on housing, health, benefits and substance misuse. Advocacy worker, resettlement and tenancy sustainment service. Shower, laundry and clothing store. Fully equipped learning centre on 1st floor offering a wide range of training courses.

Shelters.title: Step by Step - Youth AIMS
Shelters.info: Drop-in service for homeless or disadvantaged young people. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Housing advice from specialist staff. Advice available on drugs and alcohol, sexual health, family mediation, employment, education and training. Access to drug and alcohol counselling and training services for job seekers.

Shelters.title: Stonepillow - Chichester Hub
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless and vulnerably housed people. Breakfast and snack lunches, shower, laundry facilities, clothing store. Benefits information. Assistance with accessing statutory services. Life skills training. GP surgery (Thurs pm), mental health nurse. Substance misuse triage, needle exchange. Resettlement service. Leisure facilities. No 2nd night out service.

Shelters.title: The Guildford Action Day Service
Shelters.info: A day service for people who are homeless, on a low income, in need or vulnerable/marginalised. Cost price hot meals, showers, laundry facilities, clothing. Access to primary health care (GP visits regularly). Acccess & signposting to counselling, advocacy, advice & support. 1-1 support plans, group activities to increase life skills.

Shelters.title: The Porch - Steppin' Stone Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless and vulnerably housed adults. Showers, laundry, clothing store. Low cost lunch and evening meal. Referrals to emergency accommodation, pre-tenancy, resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Variety of training courses, life skills classes and support around employment and meaningful occupation. Access to computers and the internet. Art classes, sports. Open Saturday.

Shelters.title: Trinity Winchester
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless people and other disadvantaged groups. Housing advice, including referrals to emergency and longer term housing and tenancy sustainment support. Primary healthcare team including GP, CPN and podiatrist visit the centre. Needle exchange. Courses including IT, cookery, literacy and numeracy. Benefits advice. Showers, laundry, clothing store. Breakfast and lunch.

Shelters.title: Two Saints
Shelters.info: Range of services for homeless people aged 18+. Day centre providing food and use of showers, laundry facilities, clothing store. Access to primary health care. Advice on finding accommodation, benefits, alcohol, mental health and drugs. Access to accommodation via the Street Homeless Prevention Team.

Shelters.title: Vine Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day Centre for vulnerable and homeless adults, mainly but not exclusively aged 25+. Twenty services including housing and accommodation support, budget management, counselling, drop in health clinic, drug and alcohol drop in service. IT, welfare advice, lunches, washing and shower advice. Weekly Job Club, IT courses, Life Skills and Anger Management.

Shelters.title: Worthing Churches Homeless Projects - St Clare's Day Centre
Shelters.info: Range of services for homeless people or people in temporary or insecure accommodation. Day centre, with breakfast, showers, washing facilities and advice Monday-Friday 9am-12 noon, Saturday and Sunday 9am-11am. Resettlement and advice services. Nurse, chiropodist, hairdressing. IT training. Cooking and budgeting. Direct access hostel and second stage accommodation.

Shelters.title: XTRAX Young People's Centre
Shelters.info: Services for young people aged 16-25, including advice and information on homelessness and finding accommodation, benefits, sexual health, employment and training opportunities. Drug awareness and smoking cessation worker. Pregnancy testing, free condoms. Laundry, showers, cheap food and a range of recreational and social activities. Free breakfast club Monday-Friday 9am-10am.

Shelters.title: York Road Project - The Prop
Shelters.info: Day centre for people aged 18+ who are homeless or facing homelessness. Access to breakfast, showers and laundry for rough sleepers. Advice session. Computer access. Workshops offering skills training and activities such as music, art and sport. External agency referrals and meetings. Open from 8am ? 9am for rough sleepers only and 9am - 4pm for all.

Shelters.title: Alabare - Salisbury Drop In Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for homeless people and vulnerable people living in unsuitable or unstable accommodation aged 16+. Breakfast in the mornings, cooked meal served between 11.30am and 2pm, access to clothing store, laundry and washing facilities. Information, advice and support with housing and welfare benefit issues. Resettlement support. Gym, I.T. Suite, WIFI, use of telephone and activities.

Shelters.title: Bristol Methodist Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless people and people living in temporary or insecure accommodation. Shower and laundry, clothing store, free food (breakfast and lunch Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday) and tea and coffee. Sunday afternoon Soup and sandwiches Monday afternoon hot drinks. Phone, computers and internet access.

Shelters.title: Coastline Homeless Service
Shelters.info: Range of services for people who are homeless, unemployed or otherwise socially excluded. Showers and laundry facilities. Drop-in resource centre. Drugs worker. Access to GP service. Access to IT suite. Resettlement service. Substance Misuse Worker. Client Development. Crisis accommodation, move-on and supported accommodation. Reconnection service. Nightshelter open 5pm-9am daily.

Shelters.title: Crisis Centre Ministries - Wild Goose Cafe
Shelters.info: Day centre for people aged 18+ with addiction problems, homeless people, long term unemployed people and people with mental health problems. Hot meals (until 2pm & evenings), listening ear. help with finding accommodation and accessing benefits. Signposting to other services. Wet clinic clients seen on a Tuesday 2pm-4pm. Women's NIGHT SHELTER: open from 10pm Sunday -Thursday.

Shelters.title: Doorway (Chippenham)
Shelters.info: Drop-in day centre for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness and for people with complex problems such as substance use or mental health issues which affect their ability to acquire or sustain a tenancy. Provides hot meals, laundry and shower facilities, befriending, and signposting to specialist advice, information and support services. Women's Group, Tues 2pm to 4pm.

Shelters.title: Freedom Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless, vulnerable & disadvantaged people, including those experiencing problems with substance use. Basic skills & employment related support. Housing advice, including referrals to hostels, pre-tenancy, resettlement & tenancy sustainment support. Work closely with local mental health outreach team. Showers, laundry, clothing store, lunch.

Shelters.title: Julian House
Shelters.info: Day centre and nightshelter for street homeless people. Housing advice, pre-tenancy and resettlement support. Advice on welfare benefits, accessing grants, loans and furniture. Access to meaningful occupation project, with sessions on computing and life skills. Methadone programme and alcohol support. GP surgery 3 days a week, nurse Mon -Fri 9:30am-2:30pm. Showers, laundry, clothing store.

Shelters.title: One in Eight
Shelters.info: Range of services for the local community. Advice Service available on Monday's by appointment. Low cost clothes, blankets and household goods for disadvantaged, homeless people - subject to availability. Wide range of educational classes and workshops, including arts, languages, and computing - see website for details.

Shelters.title: Open Door Centre (Exmouth)
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for people in need, including homeless people. Showers, laundry, clothing store. Breakfast and lunch. Phone, computers and internet access. Housing advice. One-to-one support around literacy, numeracy and life skills. Benefits and debt advice. Late night cafe and street teams supporting Police, nightclubs etc for people in town overnight at clubs and bars. Child contact centre.

Shelters.title: Routes to Roots
Shelters.info: Provide basic necessities at drop-ins including hot food and drinks, clothing, sleeping bags and move-in packs as needed. Organise indoor and outdoor activities and assist those who are housed to remain in their tenancy. Motivational and well-being projects. Hot breakfast for rough sleepers during the winter.

Shelters.title: Shekinah Mission
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for homeless people and people who are otherwise socially excluded or vulnerable. Housing advice, including referrals and resettlement support. Mental health and drug and alcohol workers. Learning programme. Access to training scheme for users with chaotic lifestyles. Weekly sessions with CPN, GP and chiropodist. Showers, clothing, food. Access to employment training programme.

Shelters.title: SLAP (Street Level Access Programme)
Shelters.info: Drop-in for rough sleepers 12pm-2pm Sunday-Friday at Elim Connect Centre (with cooked lunch Wednesdays), and Thursdays 1pm-3pm at Redbrick Centre. Clothing store, blankets, sleeping bags and daily necessities. Laundry and washing facilities with shower on-site. Emergency food parcels. Advice on emergency and longer term housing needs. Support around substance misuse. Internet.

Shelters.title: Somewhere To Go Project for Homeless People
Shelters.info: Drop-in service for homeless people, including people who are sleeping rough and those at risk of homelessness. Breakfast and lunch, tea and coffee, showers, clothing store. CAB advice sessions Fridays. Signposting to specialist services. Outreach by other related services also provided at the centre.

Shelters.title: St Petrock's Centre (Exeter)
Shelters.info: Resource centre for people who are homeless or vulnerably housed, providing emergency, support and prevention programmes. Crisis intervention and survival services, advice on housing, benefits, health, training, employment and addiction issues, referrals to accommodation providers and other specialist services, prison in-reach and resettlement work.

Shelters.title: St Petroc's - Breadline
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for people who are homeless or unemployed. Advice on housing, benefits and health. Low cost food, showers and laundry, clothing store. Resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Benefits advice. GP surgeries and sessions with nurse Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday, CPN Wednesday. St Petroc's also run direct access hostels in the area.

Shelters.title: St Petroc's Society - Truro
Shelters.info: Services for single homeless people. Day centre with range of advice, support and practical services, including primary health care, housing advice, specialist youth worker for under 25s. Smartmove deposit bond scheme for North Cornwall and Caradon. Training and employment initiatives. Crisis intervention, mediation. Reachout street outreach team. 6 direct access hostels.

Shelters.title: The Green Hut
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for people who are homeless, unemployed, elderly or disadvantaged. Low cost lunch, tea and coffee. Clothing store. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Signposting to other agencies.

Shelters.title: SPEAR - Outreach and Resettlement Service
Shelters.info: Outreach team visits rough sleepers at their sleeping sites to contact and builds relationships with rough sleepers through face to face meetings and through our Rough Sleeper Helpline (020 8404 1481). South West London Resettlement Service provides rough sleepers, or those at risk of rough sleeping, with support and access into private rented accommodation.

Shelters.title: Coventry Jesus Centre - The Bridge Drop-in
Shelters.info: Day centre run by the Jesus Army for anyone in need. Bridge Drop-in Tuesday/Wednesday/Thursday 9 - 12 noon and Sundays 9 -10.30am for showers, laundry, clothing store, use of phone, free beans on toast, hot drinks. Support Workers and referrals to emergency housing. Agency outreach workers. Wednesday/Thursday/Friday 2-4pm Activities. Also ESOL classes, drama group, art group, cafe.

Shelters.title: Maggs Day Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in day centre for people who are homeless, isolated or on a low income. Support and advice on a range of issues including health, housing, resettlement and benefits. Hot snacks, breakfast and lunch (small charge), tea and coffee. Leisure activities. Shower facilities, laundry, clothing store.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army - Harnall Lifehouse Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless people. Provides meals, clothing, advice on finding accommodation, training and education. Signposting for benefits advice. Health care. Street outreach services.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army - Way Ahead Project (Leamington)
Shelters.info: Drop-in, advice and activity centre for people who are homeless, looking for work, vulnerably housed or struggling with mental health or addictions. Housnig and benefits advice, support, mentoring, signposting and referrals. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Breakfast, food parcels. Access to phone and computers. Showers, laundry. Cooking, computer, exercise and Faith Space groups.

Shelters.title: Shrewsbury Ark
Shelters.info: Drop-in day centre for homeless and vulnerable adults (18+). Provide food and drinks, shower and laundry facilities, access to support and housing agencies, use of phone and Internet, support with form filling and accessing services.

Shelters.title: SIFA - Fireside
Shelters.info: Drop-in centres offering advice, practical help and a resettlement service for homeless and isolated people aged 18+ with mental health issues. Hot refreshments, showers and laundry for rough sleepers, nurse, chiropodist and dental services. Mental health support. Advocacy and outreach. Breakfast and lunch. Weekday activity programme. Training and employment service.

Shelters.title: St Basils Youth Hub
Shelters.info: Advice, homelessness prevention services including Family mediation, support and advocacy for young people aged 16-25 who are in conflict with family/carer which may result in them becoming homeless. Support for young people wishing to re-establish home relationships which may result in them returning home. Help for young people and their families in accessing specialist services.

Shelters.title: St George's House
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for vulnerable people aged 18+, providing advice and support to people who are or who were at risk of becoming homeless. A range of activities are offered to enable service users to obtain basic lifeskills. Also offer a range of community learning opportunities.

Shelters.title: Ben's Centre
Shelters.info: Damp day centre for street drinkers. Referrals to specialist agencies for support around substance use and mental health, housing, debt and health issues. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Life skills classes. Job club and CV sessions. Laundry, clothing store, free breakfast and lunch. Showering/personal hygiene facilities.

Shelters.title: Carecent
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for homeless people, unemployed, disadvantaged and socially isolated people. Breakfast, tea and coffee, clothing store - by referral from local agencies. Signposting to emergency accommodation. Outreach workers from other agencies operate from the centre.

Shelters.title: Cathedral Archer Project
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for homeless and vulnerable people. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Sessions with nurse, chiropodist, dentist. Mental health outreach team by appointment. Weekly needle exchange. Literacy, numeracy art, crafts. Football & other sporting activities. Women's group. Health and well being sessions. Showers, laundry, clothing store. Free breakfast. Weekly advice session.

Shelters.title: Forge Project
Shelters.info: Day services for vulnerable people Monday, Tuesday and Friday 9.30am-1pm, including breakfast, hot drinks and lunch. Wednesday 9.30am-2.30pm Engage Project for people who wish to engage in activities. Also offer befriending and general support services.

Shelters.title: Harbour Place Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for people over 16 who are homeless or in need. Showers, clothing store, breakfast and lunch. Housing advice, pre-tenancy, resettlement & tenancy sustainment support. Dentist. Art therapy group. Job club. Advice and guidance around literacy, numeracy, life skills, jobsearch. IT training. Rough sleeper and street outreach worker.

Shelters.title: Hinge Centre & Havenfield Community Centre
Shelters.info: Resettlement support for 16-24 year olds including referrals to Nightstop. Crashpad & Supported Lodgings schemes. General resettlement support including support accessing privately rented properties and ongoing tenancy support. Washing machine, shower and kitchen facilities. Independent living skills workshops and personal development sessions for young people. Benefits and welfare support.

Shelters.title: Huddersfield Mission
Shelters.info: We run a community café that provides low cost nutritious food but also provide a wide range of advice and support. You can stay as long as you like and join in with games, the IT suite or simply have a chat. Our advice and support staff offer help around housing, benefits, sanction support, drugs and alcohol and also organise a range of activities: arts, music, space to talk, cooking.

Shelters.title: HULL HARP
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless people. Referrals to longer term housing. 21-bed nightshelter onsite. Pre-tenancy, resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Weekly sessions with nurse. Benefits advice. General counselling and support. Showers, clothing store. Lunch and evening meal (small charge for some meals), tea and coffee. Lounge, TV, computing facilities. Street outreach work.

Shelters.title: Peasholme Resettlement Day Centre
Shelters.info: Resettlement centre for single homeless people or couples without children, including rough sleepers. Referral to emergency and longer term housing. One-to-one keyworking service. Resettlement training. Social and educational group activities.

Shelters.title: St Anne's Resource Centre
Shelters.info: Day service for individuals aged 18 and over who are homeless or vulnerably housed and who may also have mental health, drug or alcohol issues. Safe mail address, shower and laundry facilities, support with housing and benefit issues. Referrals made to other agencies. Timetable of classes free to those on benefits including employment and training, life skills and ESOL.

Shelters.title: St George's Crypt Care Centre
Shelters.info: Clothing, bedding and household items for people in need. Informal advice on issues eg household bills and budgeting. 15 Bedrooms, plus 12 dormitory style beds as part of The Hub offering temporary emergency accommodation with housing advice and referrals. Resettlement and floating support services. Lunch service providing hot meals each weekday. Training and Engagement activity programme.

Shelters.title: St Mary's Rainbow Centre
Shelters.info: Social action centre for homeless people and others in need in the local community. Advice on homelessness, finding accommodation and benefits. Furniture scheme. Clothing store. Medical support.

Shelters.title: St Wilfrid's Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless and vulnerable people including those with mental health needs or who are socially excluded. Food, showers, laundry, clothing. Advice and information, including help with accessing mainstream services. Structured activities including workshop, literacy, art, drama, life skills, computing. Employment support. Skills training for independent living - cooking, budgeting etc.

Shelters.title: The Hinge - Goole
Shelters.info: Community project for people who are homeless/threatened with homelessness. Hot drinks, kitchen and IT suite. Resettlement support including budgeting skills, cookery, life skills and computer support.

Shelters.title: Streetlytes-UK
Shelters.info: Fortnightly street outreach project providing hot food, clothes, blankets and hygiene kits for street homeless people in London. Two weekly drop-ins offering food, befriending, mentoring and referral services. Also offer signposting, referrals to and liaison with building-based homelessness agencies including housing, medical and education services. Run peer-led drug awareness workshops.

Shelters.title: Justlife Centre - Manchester
Shelters.info: Provides one-to-one support, activities, workshops and referrals to empower homeless and vulnerably housed adults move towards employment, independent living and improved health and wellbeing. Helping to secure safe and stable housing for service users is key to achieving these aims. For a full timetable of activities, services and sessions please contact the Justlife centre directly.

Shelters.title: Justlife - Brighton
Shelters.info: Works to ensure people’s experience in emergency or temporary accommodation is as short, safe and healthy as possible.  Keywork and activities support people through times of crisis and help people move forward with their lives in a positive way. People can access Justlife’s support through drop-ins, activities and meals. For an up-to-date timetable please look at the Justlife website or contact Justlife Brighton directly. Also offers Pathway+, responsive support service to homeless individuals who are admitted to Royal Sussex County Hospital.

Shelters.title: Greenhouse Walk-In Centre
Shelters.info: Health care services and housing and welfare advice for homeless people in Hackney. Full health assessments, GP registration, TB screening, needle collection service. Housing advice. Welfare and benefits support. Specialist legal advice, signposting and referrals to other services.

Shelters.title: Joint Homelessness Team (JHT) - Westminster
Shelters.info: Support and housing advice for people with mental health problems who are using homelessness agencies, and for street homeless people. Assessments for community care and referrals to appropriate agencies. The team includes social workers, CPNs and psychiatrists.

Shelters.title: Start Team (Outreach for Homeless People)
Shelters.info: Assessment, treatment, care and advice for rough sleepers aged 18-65 with severe mental health problems, who are unable or unwilling to use other mental health care services. Work in day centres, hospitals and on the streets.

Shelters.title: Cambridge Access Surgery
Shelters.info: GP surgery providing health services for homeless people. Drop-in sessions every weekday morning 9.30am - 10.30am. Appointments every weekday afternoon 2pm - 4pm. Drug and alcohol clinics Tuesday and Thursday 2pm - 6pm by prior arrangement.

Shelters.title: Nottingham Homeless Health Team
Shelters.info: Health care and advice provided by nurses for homeless people at hostels and day centres and street outreach. Midwife and health visitor for homeless families at refuges and other temporary accommodation. Outreach health care and help with accessing mainstream services. Joint clinics with local GPs and other voluntary sector agencies.

Shelters.title: Leicester Homeless Primary Healthcare Service
Shelters.info: Primary health care services for homeless people in Leicester. GP and nurse consultations. Health checks, contraception, vaccinations. Health/sexual health promotion. Mental health therapy by referral. Podiatry.

Shelters.title: The Dr Hickey Surgery
Shelters.info: Drop-in primary health care service for homeless people. Fully equipped medical room, with full time GP and practice nurse. CPN. Access to a psychiatrist. General counselling and alcohol/drug counselling and treatment.

Shelters.title: Great Chapel Street Medical Centre
Shelters.info: Walk-in medical centre for homeless people in Westminster not registered with a doctor. GP and nurse available during opening hours. Drug & alcohol worker Mon-Thu during opening hours, Fri 1400-1600 only. Psychiatrist Tue/Thu by appointment. Dentist Tue/Thu by appointment. Counselling service available Mon-Wed. Podiatry drop in Fri 0900-1230. Housing advice Mon-Fri 1000-1630. Benefits advice Thu.

Shelters.title: Camden Health Improvement Practice
Shelters.info: Primary health care sessions at day centres and hostels throughout Camden. Health assessment and general health care. Well women checks. Hepatitis and HIV screening. Dental service. Alcohol and drug advice and treatment. Advice and assistance with using local health services, registering with a GP, finding a dentist or optician and on housing benefit.

Shelters.title: GSTT Health Inclusion Team for Homeless People
Shelters.info: Primary health care services in hostels, day centres and other settings for homeless people in Lambeth, Lewisham and Southwark. Services provided by GP, nurse, dentist and chiropodist. Liaise with Accident and Emergency departments.

Shelters.title: Kings Cross Primary Health Care Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in primary health care service for homeless people. Doctor and nurse available. Referrals to drug and alcohol services and GPs. Sexual health screening, HIV and hepatitis testing, hepatitis vaccination. Shower and clothes store for people using the medical facilities.

Shelters.title: Doctors of the World UK - London Clinic
Shelters.info: Walk-in information, support and advocacy to help people access health services, particularly those who are vulnerable and not registered with a GP. Help with registering with GP, accessing specialist services such as dental care, chiropody, maternity services, sexual health clinics. Information on eligibility for exemption from NHS charges. Basic medical care for acute conditions.

Shelters.title: Health E1 - Homeless Medical Centre
Shelters.info: Specialist health service for people who are homeless in the London E1 area, and can register people from E2, E3. Weekday drop-in GP surgery, with afternoon appointments available. Most service users are based in or around Tower Hamlets (either street homeless, in temporary accommodation, NFA or in hostels).

Shelters.title: Tyne Housing Association - Joseph Cowen Health Care Centre
Shelters.info: Primary health care for people who are homeless, in temporary housing or in housing need and not registered with a GP. Medical advice and treatment, needle exchange, bathing, clothing, deinfestation. Support for people with emotional/mental health problems. Pregnancy testing. Access to GPs, CPN and nurse. Advice on welfare rights, housing, local services, alcohol and drugs.

Shelters.title: Urban Village Medical Practice
Shelters.info: Range of primary health and other services available by appointment for homeless people. Drug and alcohol workers, counsellors, CPNs, nurses, GPs and midwives. Referrals to secondary care services and housing advice agencies. Outreach services. Weekly drop-in session Tuesday 2pm-4.30pm.

Shelters.title: The Lifestyles Team
Shelters.info: Health care outreach services for people who are homeless, at risk of homelessness or who are in treatment for drug or alcohol problems. Also provides advice, advocacy and appropriate onward referrals.

Shelters.title: Luther Street Medical Centre
Shelters.info: Health centre for homeless people providing primary health care (GP surgeries, visiting clinicians). Also advice on benefits, drugs and alcohol for registered patients. HIV testing, free condoms.

Shelters.title: Baker Street Clinic
Shelters.info: Access to primary health care services for hard to reach client groups such as rough sleepers, people living in temporary accommodation, travellers, refugees and asylum seekers and those without a GP. Nurse led service offering treatment for minor illnesses and injuries and health promotion.

Shelters.title: St John Ambulance - Brighton Homeless Service
Shelters.info: Primary health care and first aid services for homeless and vulnerably housed people. Nurse-led service, podiatrist, basic health assessments, referrals to appropriate local services. Mobile treatment centre: Every Monday First Base Day Centre, First Tuesday of the month: Podiatry Clinic Project Antifreeze. Every Tuesday: William Collier House. Every Thursday at Peace Statue (see Notes).

Shelters.title: Compass Health
Shelters.info: Primary health care for single homeless people, including people living in hostels, B&Bs and other forms of temporary accommodation. Health advice, minor injury care, drugs/alcohol and safer sex advice, contraceptive advice, HIV testing, hepatitis screening. Phone for details of drop-in times.

Shelters.title: SMART Team (Supervised Methadone and Resettlement Team)
Shelters.info: Supervised methadone prescribing service with counselling and support for homeless people who are opiate dependent and have a history of rough sleeping.

Shelters.title: Clock Tower Surgery
Shelters.info: GP surgery for people in Exeter who are homeless or vulnerably housed.

Shelters.title: The Health XChange
Shelters.info: Comprehensive primary care assessments, nursing care and treatment for people who are homeless in Birmingham. Drop-in clinic Mon-Fri 1pm-4pm (nurse). Doctors appts. Referral to other social and health care services. City-wide outreach visits to hostels and drop-in centres. Alcohol assessments, information, advice and support, counselling, acupuncture and referral for detox and rehab placements.

Shelters.title: Community Mental Health Team for Homeless People
Shelters.info: Community mental health team (CMHT) working with homeless people with complex psychological and social needs. Mental health and social needs assessments, accommodation, financial, and resettlement needs assessments. Work with individuals considered as NFA, i.e. people in hostels, temporary accommodation, sofa surfing, people sleeping rough or who have moved 3 times or more in the last year etc.

Shelters.title: The Anchor Centre
Shelters.info: GP service for homeless and vulnerable people who are unable to access mainstream GP services. GPs (3 mornings a week), nurse (5 days a week), CPN (1 day a week), welfare rights worker (2 days a week), women's clinic (1 day a week). One of the GPs is a drug addiction specialist.

Shelters.title: York Street Health Practice
Shelters.info: Provide primary care to the homeless and vulnerably housed people of Leeds who may have a range of issues including mental health, alcohol and drug use. Also provide registration for people currently seeking asylum.

Shelters.title: Croydon Homeless Health Team
Shelters.info: Specialist health practice for homeless people. On-site services include a GP practice 3 days a week and nurse clinics 5 days a week. Other services include immunisations and health screening for HIV, sexually transmitted infections and tuberculosis.

Shelters.title: BrisDoc
Shelters.info: Confidential healthcare, advice and support for homeless people in Bristol and South Gloucestershire.
