Services are based at The Compass Centre in Stokes Croft, Bristol, but staff offer outreach clinics in several locations around the city including The Wild Goose Cafe, One25 Logos House and Longhills. Open sessions run Monday to Friday on a drop-in basis offering general health advice and treatment, support and advice re: mental health problems, safe injecting advice, minor injury care, testing for sexually transmitted infections and pregnancy; drugs/alcohol support and referrals to other specialist services.

Shelters.title: Alone in London Service
Shelters.info: Support services for young people aged 16-25 who are homeless or at risk of becoming homeless. Services include: information and signposting; housing advice; advice on welfare benefits; general advocacy; help with getting into education, training & employment; counselling service; family mediation and mediation for young ex-offenders and their families.

Shelters.title: Birmingham Irish Association
Shelters.info: Dementia only centre for old people, including people who are homeless, isolated, living in poor accommodation, ex-offenders, those needing support around life skills. Sessions with mental health outreach team. Housing advice, including referrals to accommodation and floating support in people's own homes. Laundry, clothing, lunch. Primary health care.

Shelters.title: Brent Winter Ward

address.thoroughfare: Willesden Green Centre for Health and Care

Shelters.info: Runs throughout the year at the Willesden Green Centre for Health and Care and offers support to vulnerable people leaving hospital. Staff work with patients who have either became homeless as a result of hospital admission or are being at risk of losing their accommodation. Offer support around housing, welfare, debts, education as well as addressing further issues around social isolation.

Shelters.title: CGL - Leeds Street Outreach and Reconnections Team
Shelters.info: Advice and assistance for people at risk of street homelessness or people who are homeless. Assertive street outreach service. Assistance for those with no recourse to public funds.

Shelters.title: CGL - SST Bournemouth
Shelters.info: Assertive outreach team working with rough sleepers. Needs assessments, access to emergency accommodation, reconnection support, advice and referrals to treatment for substance misuse.

Shelters.title: Street Population Outreach Team - Kensington and Chelsea
Shelters.info: Referral to support services and access to housing for single homeless people. Make contact with people sleeping on the street.

Shelters.title: Teesside Homeless Action Group
Shelters.info: Information and support for single homeless people. Help with finding accommodation. Bond guarantee scheme to enable people to access private rented sector accommodation in Teeside. Range of self-help projects run by and for homeless people including an allotments scheme.

Shelters.title: Healthy Living Healthy Lives CIC
Shelters.info: Wrap around support for people experiencing or at risk or experiencing homelessness in the Epping Forest District. Support to register with a GP. Comprehensive health and social care check at registration with the service. Hot meals and takeaway tea. Laundry and washing facilities. Support to access housing and benefits. Advocacy. Onward referrals.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army - Faith House
Shelters.info: Drop-in for homeless and vulnerable people. Drop-in for women Tuesday 5pm-7pm and Wednesday 1pm-3pm. Drop-in for men Monday 6pm-8pm. Mixed drop-in Wednesday 7.30pm-9pm. Women's brunch and discussion group Friday 11am-1pm. Referrals. Outreach service.

Shelters.title: SanKTus
Shelters.info: Daily cooked meal and refreshments for homeless and socially excluded people. Shower facilities and clothes store Sundays 3pm-4pm. Befriending and referrals to mainstream housing, health and social care agencies.

Shelters.title: No Limits - Shirley
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre offering free and confidential information, advice, counselling, support and advocacy for children and young people under 26 years old. Free internet, Telephones, Confidential advice, Counselling, Pregnancy testing, Chlamydia screening.

Shelters.title: No Limits - Sholing
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre offering free and confidential information, advice, counselling, support and advocacy for children and young people under 26 years old. Free internet, Telephones, Confidential advice, Counselling, Pregnancy testing, Chlamydia screening.

Shelters.title: LAMP - Luton Accommodation and Move-on Project
Shelters.info: Accommodation, advice and assistance for young people aged 16-25 who are homeless or at risk of homelessness. Services include personal mentoring, life skills training and support, advice on training, employment and benefits. Prevention pack explaining what homelessness is and how to avoid it.

Shelters.title: Lift
Shelters.info: User-led organisation that aims to empower homeless people & get their views heard. 3 key areas of work: giving a voice to homeless people; preventing homelessness & increasing awareness; giving opportunities to homeless people. Research & consultancy on homelessness & social inclusion issues. A Chance 2 Work - pre-employment project offering support with finding training and employment.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army - Welcome In Youth and Community Centre
Shelters.info: Youth and community centre providing information, advice and support. Programmes and activities for young people, families, older people, homeless people and substance misusers. Caring for Carers project. Ofsted registered childcare programme. Support for people living with Parkinson's and similar conditions. Food bank. Family contact centre.

Shelters.title: The Lowdown Youth Counselling Information and Advice Service
Shelters.info: Counselling, information, advice and practical help for young people aged 12-25. Counselling available by telephone and in person. Training and consultation. Free condoms, chlamydia screening and pregnancy testing. Outreach services. Training and consultancy.

Shelters.title: Trinity Homeless Projects
Shelters.info: Training and employment centre for people who are unemployed, homeless people, ex-offenders, asylum seekers/refugees or people with alcohol/drug problems. Housing information. Accredited training in IT, customer service, numeracy, literacy, job skills (CVs, letters, interviews, job search). 6-month trainee positions at furniture stores, awarding NVQs in administration or customer service.

Shelters.title: Turnaround Resources E1
Shelters.info: Resource centre for rough sleepers, ex-rough sleepers and unemployed people. Information and guidance on welfare benefits, housing options and other related subjects. CV and interview technique preparation. UK Online Centre.

Shelters.title: Aquarius - CAN Northamptonshire
Shelters.info: Services for people with alcohol and drug problems. Counselling, groupwork, advice and information. Relapse prevention, structured programmes. Family work. Children's worker. Day centres (also at Luton, Bedford, Corby and Wellingborough). Work with offenders in the community. Housing advice and tenancy support. Education and prevention work.

Shelters.title: Housing Matters Isle of Man
Shelters.info: Services for anyone who is homeless, at risk of becoming homeless or experiencing difficulty in finding suitable accommodation. Advice and guidance on supported housing. Family mediation. Landlord/tenant mediation. Nightstop accommodation scheme in the homes of volunteer hosts.

Shelters.title: North East Lincolnshire Council - Customer Access Point (Cleethorpes)
Shelters.info: Advice and information on housing benefit, council tax benefits and debts, welfare benefits and housing. Help for homeless people, free school meals and concessionary fares. Out of hours phone 01472 324737.

Shelters.title: North East Lincolnshire Council - Customer Access Point (Immingham)
Shelters.info: Advice and information for the general public on housing benefit, council tax benefits and debts, welfare benefits, housing and help for homeless people, free school meals, school clothing grants and concessionary fares. Out of hours phone 01472 324737.

LetsHelpYou
Shelters.info: Website for landlords and tenants offering a self-service help for anyone looking for affordable housing in the private rented sector, whether in receipt of Local Housing Allowance or not. Property listings are designed for housing benefit tenants, each property shows the full rental amount followed by a second amount that compares the property rental amount to the weekly LHA for that area.

Shelters.title: Open Door MK
Shelters.info: Two drop-in centres for people who are street homeless or vulnerably housed. Services include a hot meal, washing facilities, change of clothes, toiletries and food items. Also provide advice around housing, benefits and related issues. Other agencies attend the drop-ins to provide support around health and substance misuse issues.

Shelters.title: Aldwyck Housing Group - Hertsmere Lots Scheme
Stoke on Trent City Council - Housing Solutions Service
Shelters.info: Advice on housing options and homelessness prevention. Assessment of priority need under the Housing Act. Can provide temporary accommodation for those assessed as in priority need. Advice on housing related issues including tenancy, income maximisation, rehousing. Out of hours emergencies phone 01782 234234.

Shelters.title: Connection at St Martin's Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre and support services for single homeless people. Specialist drugs, alcohol, mental health support. GP, nurse. Low cost meals. Rough sleepers prioritised at weekend. Showers, laundry, rough sleepers' luggage store. Advice for ex-service personnel from SSAFA. Arts and music activities. Women's drop-in Tuesday afternoon for existing clients. Street outreach. Workspace team help find work/training, basic computer skills, 020 7766 5547. Homeless Health runs a daily walk-in specialist nurse-led clinic Mon-Fri 9am-1pm.

Shelters.title: South Kesteven District Council - Housing Strategy and Needs
Shelters.info: Housing advice available for all residents of the district. Homelessness services provided to households who are homeless, or threatened with homelessness. Management of Council's Housing Register and assessment of housing applications. Provision of Council's Sanctuary Scheme for victims of domestic abuse. Out of hours emergencies phone 01476 590044.

Shelters.title: Accommodation Concern
Shelters.info: Advice and casework for anyone with housing problems, including homelessness. Advice and assistance with finding and keeping accommodation and street outreach (rough sleepers)services.

Shelters.title: Youth Enquiry Service - High Wycombe
Shelters.info: Information, advice, counselling and support for young people aged 13-25. Cover a range of subjects, including advice about rights, accommodation, money problems, relationships, pregnancy. Sexual health service offered advice and support, condoms, pregnancy and chlamydia testing.

Shelters.title: Shelter's Free Housing Advice Helpline
Shelters.info: Telephone advice and information for people with a housing problem or who are homeless. Issues dealt with include housing rights, harassment, illegal eviction, rent and mortgage arrears, disrepair, housing benefit, domestic violence, hostel placements and finding accommodation. Helpline open 8am-8pm Monday-Friday and 8am-5pm at weekends.

Shelters.title: Forest of Dean District Council - Housing Options Service
Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Assessment of priority housing need. General housing advice and information for private and council tenants and homeless people. Out of hours emergencies phone 01452 614194. Participates in Gloucestershire Homeseeker choice based lettings scheme to secure social housing.

Shelters.title: The London Pathway
Shelters.info: Charity working with the NHS to improve services for homeless people. Link the NHS with homelessness agencies so health services can play their part in helping homeless people come off the streets & rebuild their lives. GPs specialising in homeless medicine, Pathway homelessness nurses. Care Navigators (with personal experience of homelessness) offer 1-1 support to homeless patients in hospital.

Shelters.title: The Housing Link - Emergency Overnight Accommodation
Salvation Army - Bradford Orchard Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for single homeless and inadequately housed people aged 18+. Free meals. Laundry and showers, bath. clothing store. Referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Housing advice, pre-tenancy, resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Access to training. Cookery classes. Job search.

Shelters.title: Stockport Homes - Housing Options Team
Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Housing provided for people considered in priority need of housing. Temporary accommodation may be available while enquiries are made about eligibility. General housing advice and information for private and council tenants and homeless people.

Shelters.title: Providence Row HA - Middle Street Project
Stonham - Grove Road Young People's Services
Pathways to Independence
Shelters.info: Provide a range of services for vulnerable, single homeless people who have additional support needs. Referrals into supported accommodation projects.

Shelters.title: Cornerstone Day Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for homeless or vulnerable people have no settled address or are cut off from family and other support networks. Housing advice incl. referrals to emergency accommodation, pre-tenancy, resettlement and tenancy sustainment support. Signposting to and liaison with range of agencies for ongoing support. Showers, clothing store. Low cost breakfast and lunch. Access to phones and internet.

Shelters.title: Wycombe Homeless Connection
Shelters.info: Wycombe Homeless Concern aims to complement the work of statutory bodies, providing person-centred advice, support, advocacy, resettlement, tenancy support, eviction prevention and employment transition support. Emergency support for individuals sleeping rough, including night shelter during the months of January-March.

Shelters.title: 999 Club Day Centre
Shelters.info: Open access day centre for homeless and vulnerably housed people, from Monday to Friday from 0900-1200. Breakfast session (0900-1030) for people who are rough sleeping providing access to practical facilities (laundry, breakfast, showers, computers); people accessing this session are offered a case manager who will work with them to find sustainable housing and maximise their income. Session for vulnerably housed people (from 1030-1200), offers those who access opportunities to learn new skills and build confidence, via Learning and Activities programme including workshops to help people learn skills such as reading, writing and basic IT.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army Housing Association - Binswood Lodge
Salvation Army Housing Association - Newbold Lodge
Babergh District Council - Housing Needs Service
Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Provision of housing for people considered in priority need of housing. General housing advice and information for private or council tenants and homeless people. Rent deposit guarantee scheme for anyone in housing need.

Shelters.title: LB Lewisham - Single Homeless Intervention and Prevention Team
Shelters.info: Centralised assessment and referral service, responsible for preventing homelessness and placing vulnerable single homeless people with support needs into supported accommodation. Clients must have a local connection with Lewisham.

Shelters.title: The Medway Street Angels
Shelters.info: Street outreach service for people sleeping rough in Medway, Maidstone and Swale. Soup kitchens also. Provide hot food/drinks, camping essentials, general every day food/ drink, clothing, footwear, dog food and toiletries. Can help with benefits advice, referrals to agencies, replacement IDs, rehabilitation costs, arrange appointments with a chiropodist / podiatrist and provide Arriva bus tickets to important meetings. .

Shelters.title: LB Lewisham - Housing Options Centre
Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Temporary accommodation where a statutory duty may exist. General housing advice and information for those in housing need. Housing register enquiries. Out of hours (after 5pm) emergencies phone 020 8314 7007.

Shelters.title: Providence Row - Dellow Centre
Shelters.info: Resource Centre for homeless people. Breakfast (9 -10am), showers (9-11.30am) Housing & Benefit advice: drop in/appts (9-11.30) and substance misuse advisers. Learning and wellbeing programme with various activities and accredited trainee schemes in baking, catering and gardening. Needle exchange also available Mon-Fri 9-12.30, 1.30-3.30.

Shelters.title: Shiloh Rotherham
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for people who are marginalised or socially excluded, including homeless people, those with substance misuse problems, asylum seekers, refugees, and women experiencing domestic violence. Provide food, showers and laundry facilities. Also provide clothing and bedding.

Shelters.title: Elmbridge Rentstart
Shelters.info: Rent deposit scheme to help single people and childless couples who are on a low income to access private rented accommodation.

Shelters.title: Seaview Project
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for people in need, including homeless people. Advice on benefits, education, training, jobsearch. Housing advice, including pre-tenancy, resettlement, tenancy sustainment. Sessions with mental health outreach team, nurse, chiropodist. Regular visits from specialist substance misuse agencies. Showers, laundry, clothing, low cost lunch.

Shelters.title: Riverside Care and Support - Amber Valley Projects
KiP @ Maninplace
Shelters.info: Information project for homeless people. Drop-in facility, plus food available for rough sleepers in need. Information on local services, benefits, housing rights, alcohol and drugs. Registration and referral to emergency accommodation. Washing facilities, clothing, food parcels, bedding and toiletries.

Shelters.title: St Mungo's - Reading Street Outreach Team
Shelters.info: Street outreach team supporting people sleeping rough in Reading 6am-as needed, Monday-Friday. Also run drop-in sessions at CIRDIC, Berkeley Avenue Fridays 11am-1pm.

Shelters.title: LB Tower Hamlets - Housing Options Service
Shelters.info: Advice and assistance to prevent homelessness, including money advice. Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Accommodation provided for people who qualify for assistance. Social work and tenancy sustainment support for vulnerable households in priority need. Rent deposit scheme. Out of hours emergencies phone 0300 123 1212

Shelters.title: Liverpool City Council - Housing Options Service
Shelters.info: Homelessness prevention and assessment service. Advice and information for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness on finding accommodation, prevention work including mediation, negotiation with landlords, rent deposit scheme. Assessment of priority need under the Housing Act. Service available through the Council's One Stop Shops. Telephone service 24 hours a day.

Shelters.title: Faith, Hope and Enterprise

address.premise: Derby West Business Centre, Ashbourne Road

Shelters.info: Mentoring and coaching service, support and information for single homeless people and those who are disadvantaged. Subjects covered include welfare rights and benefits, family problems, legal problems, finding accommodation, employment and education and training.

Shelters.title: Richmondshire District Council - Housing Unit
Shelters.info: Assessment of priority need under the Housing Act. Can provide temporary accommodation for those assessed as in priority need - those with children or pregnant, vulnerable because of age (60+), disability or at risk from violence. Also offers general housing advice and information to private and council tenants, and homeless people. Out of hours emergencies phone 01653 690738.

Shelters.title: Welwyn Hatfield Borough Council - Housing Options
Shelters.info: Housing advice and options service, including services for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Assessment of priority need under the Housing Act. General housing advice and information to private and council tenants, and homeless people. Out of hours emergencies phone 0800 111 4484.

Shelters.title: Bristol City Council  Citizen Service Point - Temple Street
Shelters.info: Customer Services One Stop office offering housing advice, assessment and information. Areas covered include family homelessness and rehousing on the Housing Register. Information on council services in general.

Shelters.title: Shelter - Sheffield Hub
Shelters.info: A team of advisers and solicitors offer a wide range of help and advice to single people and families on all housing and homelessness issues. Issues covered include homelessness, looking for accommodation, having problems with your landlord, being evicted or repossessed, debt problems, benefits issues, problems with disrepair, need help going to court regarding your housing. Computers and telephones are available to clients to access the internet for advice, claim benefits, or bid on properties.

Shelters.title: Salvation Army Housing Association - The Limes
Herefordshire Council - Housing Solutions Team
Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Housing provided for people considered in priority need of housing. Temporary accommodation may be available while enquiries are made about eligibility. General housing advice and information for private and council tenants and homeless people. Out of hours emergencies phone 01432 260000.

Shelters.title: Kings Cross Christian Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for people who are homeless, jobless or in need. Cooked breakfast, tea, coffee and conversation. Signposting and advice.

Shelters.title: YMCA St Paul’s Group - Young People Supported Lodging (YPSL)
St Albans City and District Council - Housing Options Team
Shelters.info: Housing options team working to prevent homelessness through an options based approach. General housing advice and information. Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless or threatened with homelessness. Provision of housing for people in priority need of housing. Access to credit union and prevention fund, loan and deposit funds. Out of hours emergencies phone 01727 811155.

Shelters.title: Hope 4 (Rugby)
Shelters.info: Day centre for people who are homeless or badly housed, who have been referred by a local agency (including churches, social housing providers, homelessness agencies and the local authority). Cooked meal, shower and laundry facilities, advice and signposting.

Shelters.title: Zacchaeus 2000 Trust
Shelters.info: Information, advice and advocacy services for households threatened with homelessness. Private rented sector access scheme open to anyone unable to access statutory assistance ie non-priority and intentionally homeless families. 6 week deposit guarantee available for Westminster residents whose housing has been affected by the new welfare changes.

Shelters.title: Calderdale SmartMove
Shelters.info: Assist people who are on benefits or low incomes and who are homeless or in housing need to access housing, by guaranteeing a bond on their behalf. Also provide support for people in their own tenancies.

Shelters.title: Dudley Rent Deposit Scheme
Shelters.info: Deposit bond guarantee for people looking to rent in the private sector in Dudley Borough who are unable to meet the landlords requirement for a cash deposit. Phone 0300 555 2345 or 01384 817760 for details. Signposting service.Tenancy sustainment support.

Shelters.title: Elim Connect Centre
Shelters.info: Services include a daily (no appointment required) drop-in clinic where new and existing service users can access services and get connected with support. Services at Wells (Elim Connect Centre, Portway, Wells) include mail collection, laundry and showers can be accessed/arranged by dropping in to the Connect Centre between 12– 4pm, Mon-Fri.Connecting Sessions: Mon: 9:am-11am (Breakfast), Wed: 12:00-2pm (Community Lunch), Fri: 3-5pm (Soup). Drop-in clinic  in Glastonbury / Street (Red Brick Building, Morland Enterprise Park, Morland Road, Glastonbury) - Thurs 1pm-3pm. Drop-in clinic Frome (The Elliot Building, Christchurch Street) Tues 11am-1pm. Rough Sleeper Outreach Service specialises in providing immediate and wide-ranging support (from housing to health) for anyone who finds themselves, or is reported to be, sleeping rough. Community Outreach supports change in people challenged by complex and multiple needs – such as homelessness, addiction, mental health or other life-controlling issues. Work with key organisations across Mendip, to enable fast and effective access to a wide range of services providing short and long-term, person-centred support.

Shelters.title: Churches Housing Action Team (Mid Devon)
Shelters.info: Advice, information and support for those who are homeless or in housing need or those in accommodation who need housing advice. Also operate a Deposit Guarantee (Bond) Scheme to enable people to access private rented accommodation and offer tenancy support. Outreach ? Mid Devon District Council Offices, Market Street, Crediton Tuesday 2pm - 4.30pm.

Shelters.title: SSJ - Homeless Day Services
Shelters.info: Day centre providing advice and support for single homeless people and those who are inappropriately housed. Housing advice, including referrals to emergency and longer term housing. Bond deposit scheme. Regular surgeries with local drug and alcohol agencies. Showers, laundry, clothing store. Low cost lunch, tea and coffee.

Shelters.title: Thames Reach - Spectrum Centre
Shelters.info: Day centre for single homeless people. Housing advice. Help for people with alcohol, drug or mental health problems. Referrals to CPN. Podiatrist once a month. Laundry and shower facilities.

Shelters.title: RB Kingston - Housing Options Service
Shelters.info: Advice for tenants, landlords and homeless people on all aspects of renting and letting accommodation in the private rented sector. Issues covered include finding accommodation, rent in advance and deposits, tenancy rights and obligations, rents and housing benefit, debt, prevention of homelessness. Advice for owner occupiers on mortgage arrears and leasehold rights.

Shelters.title: Wirral Churches' Ark Project - Mary Cole House
LB Waltham Forest - Housing Assessment and Options Unit
Shelters.info: Assessment of priority need under the Housing Act. Can provide temporary accommodation for those assessed as in priority need - those with children or pregnant, vulnerable because of age, disability or at risk from violence. After 6pm out of hours emergency phone 020 8496 3000. Operate a rent deposit scheme.

Shelters.title: Kingston Churches Action on Homelessness - Housing Crisis Intervention Service
Shelters.info: Drop-in Advice Service (the 'Housing Crisis Intervention Service') offers advice on housing and benefits, maximising income, statutory rights, accessing health services and securing accommodation. In line with homelessness legislation, which dictates a person's local connection to be resident in a borough for six out of twelve months or three years out of five, KCAH prioritises those clients with a connection to Kingston upon Thames. New clients should come to a morning drop-in session which are run Mondays to Fridays from 10am to 1pm.

Shelters.title: Kingston Churches Action on Homelessness - Access Project
Mid Suffolk District Council - Housing Options
Shelters.info: Assessment of priority need under the Housing Act. General housing advice and information to private and council tenants and homeless people. Out of hours emergencies, phone 0808 168 4555.

Shelters.title: Northampton Hope Centre
Shelters.info: A day centre for the homeless, vulnerable and disadvantaged of Northampton, providing basic services (food, clothing, hot showers, hot drinks) and personal development via workshops and activities including: cookery, art, computing, health & well-being including relaxation and chiropody, sport, outings. Also provide access to computers, social activities. Training and work placements.

Shelters.title: Glebe Centre
Shelters.info: Resource centre for people over 18, including those who are homeless, unemployed, who have mental health problems or substance abuse problems. Breakfast, lunch, hot drinks, showers, clothing store. Full time addiction workers. Advice on benefits, housing and health. Leisure activities, including pool and snooker. TV lounge. Alcohol drinking lounge (wet room) for clients to gain support.

Shelters.title: Streetcare
Shelters.info: Drop-in centre for homeless people and others in need, including single parents, unemployed people and people on low incomes. Free tea, coffee and snacks. 3 course lunch 1st and 3rd Saturday of the month at St Gabriel's Church, Chester Road.

Shelters.title: Genesis Trust - Lifeline Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in day centre offering immediate support for people who are homeless, vulnerably housed or those experiencing complex problems, such as financial insecurity or drug and alcohol addiction. We provide a warm, safe and welcoming space with hot drinks, emergency food parcels, clothing, toiletries, and a shower and wash facilities.

Shelters.title: Fountain Day Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in day centre for homeless people. Offer shelter, breakfast, lunch, life skills support, English classes, internet access and social and emotional support.

Shelters.title: Shelter - Dorset Housing Aid Centre
Shelters.info: Offer a wide range of help and advice on all housing and homelessness issues through a team of advisers and solicitors who may be able to help you with your problem or signpost to other agencies who can. Computers and telephones available tto access the internet for advice, claim benefits, or bid on properties.  Issues we can deal with include homelessness, or worried you'll soon become homeless, looking for accommodation, having problems with your landlord, being evicted or repossessed, debt problems, benefits issues, problems with disrepair, in need help going to court regarding housing.

Shelters.title: Leeds City Council - Housing Options
Shelters.info: Advice on housing and related matters, including assessment of housing entitlement for homeless people. Provides temporary accommodation where appropriate. Advice for private tenants, home owners in mortgage arrears, homeless people or those threatened with homelessness, single people or families. Details of available council properties. Out of hours emergencies phone - 07891 273 939.

Shelters.title: St Mungo's - North London Women's Hostel
Wyre Forest Council - Housing - Options
Shelters.info: Assessment of entitlement to housing for people who are homeless, threatened with homelessness. Provision of housing for people considered in priority housing need. Temporary accommodation may be available whilst eligibility enquiries are made. Also offer general housing advice and information for private and council tenants and homeless people. Out of hours emergencies phone 01562 850053.

Shelters.title: Humankind Independent Living Unit
Shelters.info: Housing related support for people with mental health problems living in Darlington; Housing related support for young people aged 16-25 living in County Durham and Stockton on Tees; Housing related support for the Gypsy, Roma and traveller community living in County Durham; Housing related support for people living in County Durham who are at risk of eviction due to their anti-social behaviour.

Shelters.title: Humankind
Shelters.info: Support, information, advice and guidance for people in the community who are disadvantaged or marginalised. Humankind run a wide range of projects focusing on access to employment, education and training, substance misuse, criminal justice, housing related support services, accommodation based projects, services for children and young people.

Shelters.title: Beacon House Day Centre
Shelters.info: Drop-in service for homeless people and those living in temporary or insecure housing. Showers, laundry, clothing, toiletries. Nurse based at the centre Monday-Friday 10am-2pm. Life skills classes, including IT, CV writing, support around cooking and budgeting. Counselling. Cafe from 10-1.30, offering hot meals, IT suite, art and craft room, games and drop-in support from other agencies.

Shelters.title: Shelter London - Public Advice Line
Shelters.info: Specialist telephone advice on matters relating to housing, debt and welfare for people over the age of 25.

Shelters.title: Shelter - London Housing Advice Appointment Service
Shelters.info: Specialist advice on housing, debt and welfare for people over the age of 25. Services include help accessing employment, accommodation and local services. These services are provided at outreach sessions (by appointment only) in Hackney, Newham, Camden, Hammersmith and Fulham, Barking, Lambeth, Bromley, Barnet, Ealing and Lewisham.

Shelters.title: The Margins Project (Union Chapel)
Shelters.info: Margins run two weekly crisis drop-ins from 11am to 2pm. The drop-ins offer food, a hot shower and support covering health, housing, money and legal issues. Run a winter night shelter as part of the Caris network every Wednesday night from January to March. Offer overnight shelter, a nutritious meal and a hot breakfast for up to 17 guests. In addition to the crisis services, develop people’s confidence and recovery through art and framing sessions, English classes, an employability programme and therapy sessions.Also offer a cafe training programme.

Shelters.title: Birmingham City Mission
Shelters.info: Services for homeless and disadvantaged people. Free food, clothing, meals, general advice and emotional support. Furniture store with clothes and household items. Mobile advice services. Visit elderly, housebound people offering practical help and spiritual advice. Run lunch clubs for elderly people. The Resource Centre is  where people can pick-up a food parcel from the Foodbank which is open Tue/Wed/Thu from 10-4 pm and also offers furniture and complete furniture packages for £100 when you move into an unfurnished home. The 'Care Centre' (different Location) serves food to homeless people on a Mon, Tues and Thurs evening from 5:30pm-7:30 pm at 8-10 Washington Street, Birmingham B1 1JR.
